</div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av ew hi hj hk de dc dd hl hm aq cl\">\n           Text Classification\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"a995\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           Latest Update:\n          </strong>\n          <br/>\n          I have uploaded the complete code (Python and Jupyter notebook) on GitHub:\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"https://github.com/javedsha/text-classification\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           https://github.com/javedsha/text-classification\n          </a>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"cba3\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           Document/Text classification\n          </strong>\n          is one of the important and typical task in\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           supervised\n          </em>\n          machine learning (ML). Assigning categories to documents, which can be a web page, library book, media articles, gallery etc. has many applications like e.g. spam filtering, email routing, sentiment analysis etc. In this article, I would like to demonstrate how we can do text classification using python, scikit-learn and little bit of NLTK.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"1355\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           <em class=\"ig\">\n            Disclaimer\n           </em>\n           :\n          </strong>\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           I am new to machine learning and also to blogging (First). So, if there are any mistakes, please do let me know. All feedback appreciated.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"9739\">\n          Let\u2019s divide the classification problem into below steps:\n         </p>\n         <ol class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia ih ii ij\" id=\"6b01\">\n           Prerequisite and setting up the environment.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq ik hs il hu im hw in hy io ia ih ii ij\" id=\"cd4e\">\n           Loading the data set in jupyter.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq ik hs il hu im hw in hy io ia ih ii ij\" id=\"d09c\">\n           Extracting features from text files.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq ik hs il hu im hw in hy io ia ih ii ij\" id=\"d470\">\n           Running ML algorithms.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq ik hs il hu im hw in hy io ia ih ii ij\" id=\"9ce4\">\n           Grid Search for parameter tuning.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq ik hs il hu im hw in hy io ia ih ii ij\" id=\"61ec\">\n           Useful tips and a touch of NLTK.\n          </li>\n         </ol>\n         <h2 class=\"ip iq dt ar aq ir is it iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb jc\" id=\"2871\">\n          <strong class=\"bd\">\n           Step 1: Prerequisite and setting up the environment\n          </strong>\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq jd hs je hu jf hw jg hy jh ia dl\" id=\"74c8\">\n          The prerequisites to follow this example are python version\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           2.7.3\n          </strong>\n          and jupyter notebook.\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           You can just install\n          </strong>\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"https://www.continuum.io/downloads\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n            anaconda\n           </strong>\n          </a>\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           and it will get everything for you.\n          </strong>\n          Also, little bit of python and ML basics including text classification is required. We will be using scikit-learn (python) libraries for our example.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ip iq dt ar aq ir is it iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb jc\" id=\"6519\">\n          <strong class=\"bd\">\n           Step 2:\n          </strong>\n          Loading the data set in jupyter.\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq jd hs je hu jf hw jg hy jh ia dl\" id=\"9319\">\n          The data set will be using for this example is the famous \u201c20 Newsgoup\u201d data set. About the data from the original\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"http://qwone.com/~jason/20Newsgroups/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           website\n          </a>\n          :\n         </p>\n         <blockquote class=\"ji jj jk\">\n          <p class=\"hn ho dt ig hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"2916\">\n           The 20 Newsgroups data set is a collection of approximately 20,000 newsgroup documents, partitioned (nearly) evenly across 20 different newsgroups. To the best of my knowledge, it was originally collected by Ken Lang, probably for his\n           <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"http://qwone.com/~jason/20Newsgroups/lang95.bib\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            Newsweeder: Learning to filter netnews\n           </a>\n           paper, though he does not explicitly mention this collection. The 20 newsgroups collection has become a popular data set for experiments in text applications of machine learning techniques, such as text classification and text clustering.\n          </p>\n         </blockquote>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"75ef\">\n          This data set is in-built in scikit, so we don\u2019t need to download it explicitly.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"cf3f\">\n          i. Open command prompt in windows and type \u2018jupyter notebook\u2019. This will open the notebook in browser and start a session for you.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"94e8\">\n          ii. Select New &gt; Python 2. You can give a name to the notebook -\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           Text Classification Demo 1\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"gm gn go gp gq gr dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"gs gt gu gv ai\">\n           <div class=\"dc dd jl\">\n            <div class=\"hb r gu hc\">\n             <div class=\"jm r\">\n              <div class=\"gw gx s t u gy ai br gz ha\">\n               <img class=\"s t u gy ai he hf hg\" height=\"294\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png?q=20\" width=\"1172\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"gw gx s t u gy ai hh\" height=\"294\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png 700w\" width=\"1172\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u gy ai\" height=\"294\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2344/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*21FHNsyMi_HCZv25rkeemA.png 700w\" width=\"1172\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"7132\">\n          iii. Loading the data set: (this might take few minutes, so patience)\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"14e7\">from sklearn.datasets import fetch_20newsgroups<br/>twenty_train = fetch_20newsgroups(subset='train', shuffle=True)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"f394\">\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           Note: Above, we are only loading the\n          </em>\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           <em class=\"ig\">\n            training\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           data. We will load the test data separately later in the example.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"d185\">\n          iv. You can check the target names (categories) and some data files by following commands.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"a741\">twenty_train.target_names #prints all the categories<br/>print(\"\\n\".join(twenty_train.data[0].split(\"\\n\")[:3])) #prints first line of the first data file</span></pre>\n         <h2 class=\"ip iq dt ar aq ir is it iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb jc\" id=\"ae22\">\n          <strong class=\"bd\">\n           Step 3: Extracting features from text files.\n          </strong>\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq jd hs je hu jf hw jg hy jh ia dl\" id=\"38f1\">\n          Text files are actually series of words (ordered). In order to run machine learning algorithms we need to convert the text files into numerical feature vectors. We will be using\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bag-of-words_model\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n            bag of words\n           </strong>\n          </a>\n          model for our example. Briefly, we segment each text file into words (for English splitting by space), and count # of times each word occurs in each document and finally assign each word an integer id.\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           Each unique word in our dictionary will correspond to a feature (descriptive feature).\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"c01b\">\n          Scikit-learn has a high level component which will create feature vectors for us \u2018CountVectorizer\u2019. More about it\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.feature_extraction.text.CountVectorizer.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           here\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"15ed\">from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import CountVectorizer<br/>count_vect = CountVectorizer()<br/>X_train_counts = count_vect.fit_transform(twenty_train.data)<br/>X_train_counts.shape</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"279b\">\n          Here by doing \u2018\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           count_vect.fit_transform(twenty_train.data)\n          </em>\n          \u2019, we are learning the vocabulary dictionary and it returns a Document-Term matrix. [n_samples, n_features].\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"ab16\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           TF:\n          </strong>\n          Just counting the number of words in each document has 1 issue: it will give more weightage to longer documents than shorter documents. To avoid this, we can use frequency (\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           TF - Term Frequencies\n          </strong>\n          ) i.e. #count(word) / #Total words, in each document.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"f46c\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           TF-IDF:\n          </strong>\n          Finally, we can even reduce the weightage of more common words like (the, is, an etc.) which occurs in all document. This is called as\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           TF-IDF i.e Term Frequency times inverse document frequency.\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"c202\">\n          We can achieve both using below line of code:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"2196\">from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import TfidfTransformer<br/>tfidf_transformer = TfidfTransformer()<br/>X_train_tfidf = tfidf_transformer.fit_transform(X_train_counts)<br/>X_train_tfidf.shape</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"6e48\">\n          The last line will output the dimension of the Document-Term matrix -&gt; (11314, 130107).\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ip iq dt ar aq ir is it iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb jc\" id=\"fcf7\">\n          <strong class=\"bd\">\n           Step 4. Running ML algorithms.\n          </strong>\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq jd hs je hu jf hw jg hy jh ia dl\" id=\"bb19\">\n          There are various algorithms which can be used for text classification. We will start with the most simplest one \u2018\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/naive_bayes.html#naive-bayes\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Naive Bayes\n          </a>\n          (NB)\u2019 (\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           don\u2019t think it is too Naive!\n          </em>\n          \ud83d\ude03)\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"30ee\">\n          You can easily build a NBclassifier in scikit using below 2 lines of code: (note - there are many variants of NB, but discussion about them is out of scope)\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"8368\">from sklearn.naive_bayes import MultinomialNB<br/>clf = MultinomialNB().fit(X_train_tfidf, twenty_train.target)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"e520\">\n          This will train the NB classifier on the training data we provided.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"37ef\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           Building a pipeline:\n          </strong>\n          We can write less code and do all of the above, by building a pipeline as follows:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"9e73\"><strong class=\"jp ib\">&gt;&gt;&gt; from</strong> <strong class=\"jp ib\">sklearn.pipeline</strong> <strong class=\"jp ib\">import</strong> Pipeline<br/><strong class=\"jp ib\">&gt;&gt;&gt; </strong>text_clf = Pipeline([('vect', CountVectorizer()),<br/><strong class=\"jp ib\">... </strong>                     ('tfidf', TfidfTransformer()),<br/><strong class=\"jp ib\">... </strong>                     ('clf', MultinomialNB()),<br/><strong class=\"jp ib\">... </strong>])</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"2b91\">text_clf = text_clf.fit(twenty_train.data, twenty_train.target)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"3034\">\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           The names \u2018vect\u2019 , \u2018tfidf\u2019 and \u2018clf\u2019 are arbitrary but will be used later.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"e934\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           Performance of NB Classifier:\n          </strong>\n          Now we will test the performance of the NB classifier on\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           test set\n          </strong>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"6984\">import numpy as np<br/>twenty_test = fetch_20newsgroups(subset='test', shuffle=True)<br/>predicted = text_clf.predict(twenty_test.data)<br/>np.mean(predicted == twenty_test.target)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"ff89\">\n          The accuracy we get is\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           ~77.38%\n          </strong>\n          , which is not bad for start and for a naive classifier. Also, congrats!!! you have now written successfully a text classification algorithm \ud83d\udc4d\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"ccd7\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           Support Vector Machines (SVM):\n          </strong>\n          Let\u2019s try using a different algorithm SVM, and see if we can get any better performance. More about it\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/svm.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           here\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"6a55\">&gt;&gt;&gt; from sklearn.linear_model import SGDClassifier</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"09b7\">&gt;&gt;&gt; text_clf_svm = Pipeline([('vect', CountVectorizer()),<br/>...                      ('tfidf', TfidfTransformer()),<br/>...                      ('clf-svm', SGDClassifier(loss='hinge', penalty='l2',<br/>...                                            alpha=1e-3, n_iter=5, random_state=42)),<br/>... ])</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"c9dc\">&gt;&gt;&gt; _ = text_clf_svm.fit(twenty_train.data, twenty_train.target)</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"51e9\">&gt;&gt;&gt; predicted_svm = text_clf_svm.predict(twenty_test.data)<br/>&gt;&gt;&gt; np.mean(predicted_svm == twenty_test.target)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"297c\">\n          The accuracy we get is\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           ~82.38%.\n          </strong>\n          Yipee, a little better \ud83d\udc4c\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ip iq dt ar aq ir is it iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb jc\" id=\"4268\">\n          <strong class=\"bd\">\n           Step 5. Grid Search\n          </strong>\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq jd hs je hu jf hw jg hy jh ia dl\" id=\"b317\">\n          Almost all the classifiers will have various parameters which can be tuned to obtain optimal performance. Scikit gives an extremely useful tool \u2018GridSearchCV\u2019.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"83d9\">&gt;&gt;&gt; from sklearn.model_selection import GridSearchCV<br/>&gt;&gt;&gt; parameters = {'vect__ngram_range': [(1, 1), (1, 2)],<br/>...               'tfidf__use_idf': (True, False),<br/>...               'clf__alpha': (1e-2, 1e-3),<br/>... }</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"b707\">\n          Here, we are creating a list of parameters for which we would like to do performance tuning. All the parameters name start with the classifier name (remember the arbitrary name we gave). E.g. vect__ngram_range; here we are telling to use unigram and bigrams and choose the one which is optimal.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"37e6\">\n          Next, we create an instance of the grid search by passing the classifier, parameters and n_jobs=-1 which tells to use multiple cores from user machine.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"6f3d\">gs_clf = GridSearchCV(text_clf, parameters, n_jobs=-1)<br/>gs_clf = gs_clf.fit(twenty_train.data, twenty_train.target)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"c3b4\">\n          This might take few minutes to run depending on the machine configuration.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"23f2\">\n          Lastly, to see the best mean score and the params, run the following code:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"92cc\">gs_clf.best_score_<br/>gs_clf.best_params_</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"b124\">\n          The accuracy has now increased to\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           ~90.6%\n          </strong>\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           for the NB classifier\n          </strong>\n          (not so naive anymore! \ud83d\ude04) and the corresponding parameters are {\u2018clf__alpha\u2019: 0.01, \u2018tfidf__use_idf\u2019: True, \u2018vect__ngram_range\u2019: (1, 2)}.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"fbda\">\n          Similarly, we get improved accuracy\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           ~89.79%\n          </strong>\n          for SVM classifier with below code.\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           Note: You can further optimize the SVM classifier by tuning other parameters. This is left up to you to explore more.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"7ca7\">&gt;&gt;&gt; from sklearn.model_selection import GridSearchCV<br/>&gt;&gt;&gt; parameters_svm = {'vect__ngram_range': [(1, 1), (1, 2)],<br/>...               'tfidf__use_idf': (True, False),<br/>...               'clf-svm__alpha': (1e-2, 1e-3),<br/>... }<br/>gs_clf_svm = GridSearchCV(text_clf_svm, parameters_svm, n_jobs=-1)<br/>gs_clf_svm = gs_clf_svm.fit(twenty_train.data, twenty_train.target)<br/>gs_clf_svm.best_score_<br/>gs_clf_svm.best_params_</span></pre>\n         <h2 class=\"ip iq dt ar aq ir is it iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb jc\" id=\"1dd2\">\n          <strong class=\"bd\">\n           Step 6:\n          </strong>\n          Useful tips and a touch of NLTK.\n         </h2>\n         <ol class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq jd hs je hu jf hw jg hy jh ia ih ii ij\" id=\"6331\">\n           <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n            Removing\n           </strong>\n           <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stop_words\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n             stop words\n            </strong>\n           </a>\n           <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n            :\n           </strong>\n           (the, then etc) from the data. You should do this only when stop words are not useful for the underlying problem. In most of the text classification problems, this is indeed not useful. Let\u2019s see if removing stop words increases the accuracy. Update the code for creating object of CountVectorizer as follows:\n          </li>\n         </ol>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"1cc1\">&gt;&gt;&gt; from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline<br/>&gt;&gt;&gt; text_clf = Pipeline([('vect', CountVectorizer(<strong class=\"jp ib\">stop_words='english</strong>')),<br/>...                      ('tfidf', TfidfTransformer()),<br/>...                      ('clf', MultinomialNB()),<br/>... ])</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"2725\">\n          This is the pipeline we build for NB classifier. Run the remaining steps like before. This improves the accuracy from\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           77.38% to 81.69%\n          </strong>\n          (that is too good).\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           You can try the same for SVM and also while doing grid search.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"0108\">\n          2.\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           FitPrior=False:\n          </strong>\n          When set to false for\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.naive_bayes.MultinomialNB.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           MultinomialNB\n          </a>\n          , a uniform prior will be used. This doesn\u2019t helps that much, but increases the accuracy from 81.69% to 82.14% (not much gain).\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           Try and see if this works for your data set.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"3725\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           3. Stemming:\n          </strong>\n          From\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stemming\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Wikipedia\n          </a>\n          , stemming is the process of reducing inflected (or sometimes derived) words to their word stem, base or root form. E.g. A stemming algorithm reduces the words \u201cfishing\u201d, \u201cfished\u201d, and \u201cfisher\u201d to the root word, \u201cfish\u201d.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"b57d\">\n          We need NLTK which can be installed from\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"http://www.nltk.org/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           here\n          </a>\n          . NLTK comes with various stemmers (\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           details on how stemmers work are out of scope for this article\n          </em>\n          ) which can help reducing the words to their root form. Again use this, if it make sense for your problem.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"c8c8\">\n          Below I have used Snowball stemmer which works very well for English language.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq jn jo ca\"><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jq jr r js\" id=\"0dbf\">import nltk<br/>nltk.download()</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"1e58\">from nltk.stem.snowball import SnowballStemmer<br/>stemmer = SnowballStemmer(\"english\", ignore_stopwords=True)</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"40d2\">class StemmedCountVectorizer(CountVectorizer):<br/>    def build_analyzer(self):<br/>        analyzer = super(StemmedCountVectorizer, self).build_analyzer()<br/>        return lambda doc: ([stemmer.stem(w) for w in analyzer(doc)])</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"ac06\">stemmed_count_vect = StemmedCountVectorizer(stop_words='english')</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"0fba\">text_mnb_stemmed = Pipeline([('vect', stemmed_count_vect),<br/>...                      ('tfidf', TfidfTransformer()),<br/>...                      ('mnb', MultinomialNB(fit_prior=False)),<br/>... ])</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"441a\">text_mnb_stemmed = text_mnb_stemmed.fit(twenty_train.data, twenty_train.target)</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"873e\">predicted_mnb_stemmed = text_mnb_stemmed.predict(twenty_test.data)</span><span class=\"ip iq dt ar jp b ew jt ju jv jw jx jr r js\" id=\"a740\">np.mean(predicted_mnb_stemmed == twenty_test.target)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"7481\">\n          The accuracy with stemming we get is ~81.67%. Marginal improvement in our case with NB classifier. You can also try out with SVM and other algorithms.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"08ce\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           Conclusion:\n          </strong>\n          We have learned the classic problem in NLP, text classification. We learned about important concepts like bag of words, TF-IDF and 2 important algorithms NB and SVM. We saw that for our data set, both the algorithms were almost equally matched when optimized.\n          <em class=\"ig\">\n           Sometimes\n          </em>\n          , if we have enough data set, choice of algorithm can make hardly any difference. We also saw, how to perform grid search for performance tuning and used NLTK stemming approach. You can use this code on your data set and see which algorithms works best for you.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"ea41\">\n          <strong class=\"hp ib\">\n           Update:\n          </strong>\n          If anyone tries a different algorithm, please share the results in the comment section, it will be useful for everyone.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"148d\">\n          Please let me know if there were any mistakes and feedback is welcome \u270c\ufe0f\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"8752\">\n          Recommend, comment, share if you liked this article.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ip iq dt ar aq ir is it iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb jc\" id=\"1049\">\n          <strong class=\"bd\">\n           References:\n          </strong>\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq jd hs je hu jf hw jg hy jh ia dl\" id=\"ced3\">\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"http://scikit-learn.org/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           http://scikit-learn.org/\n          </a>\n          (code)\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hn ho dt ar hp b hq hr hs ht hu hv hw hx hy hz ia dl\" id=\"ca17\">\n          <a class=\"cq fx ic id ie if\" href=\"http://qwone.com/~jason/20Newsgroups/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           http://qwone.com/~jason/20Newsgroups/\n          </a>\n          (data set)\n class=\"fw bx gj lk\">\n           <a class=\"ll lm fx av r jo ln a b cm\" href=\"/tag/machine-learning\">\n            Machine Learning\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"fw bx gu\">\n           <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gh gi bj bk fd fe\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=register&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fmachine-learning-nlp-text-classification-using-scikit-learn-python-and-nltk-c52b92a7c73a&amp;source=post_actions_footer-----c52b92a7c73a---------------------clap_footer-\" .22.07.42.17.61zm14.79 19.18a7.46 7.46 0 0 1-6.41 2.31 7.92 7.92 0 0 1-3.67.9c-3.05 0-6.12-1.63-8.36-3.88l-6.4-6.4A2.31 2.31 0 0 1 2 19.72a2.33 2.33 0 0 1 1.92-2.3l-.87-.87a2.34 2.34 0 0 1 0-3.3 2.33 2.36-2.84zM16.5 3.3L15.48 0h2.04L16.5 3.3z\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n               </path>\n              </svg>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"lf r\">\n           <div class=\"lg\">\n            <h4 class=\"aq cl ew as dt\">\n             <button class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gh gi bj bk fd fe\">\n              5.8K claps\n             </button>\n            </h4>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <div class=\"n o\">\n          <div class=\"gg r an\">\n           <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gh gi bj bk fd fe\" href=\"//medium.com/p/c52b92a7c73a/share/twitter?source=post_actions_footer---------------------------\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            <svg class=\"q\" height=\"29\" width=\"29\">\n             <path d=\"M22.05 7.54a4.47 4.47 0 0 0-3.3-1.46 4.53 4.53 0 0 0-4.53 4.53c0 .35.04.7.08 1.05A12.9 12.9 0 0 1 5 6.89a5.1 5.1 0 0 0-.65 2.26c.03 1.6.83 2.99 2.02 3.79a4.3 4.3 0 0 1-2.02-.57v.08a4.55 4.55 0 0 0 3.63 4.44c-.4.08-.8.13-1.21.16l-.81-.08a4.54 4.54 0 0 0 4.2 3.15 9.56 9.56 0 0 1-5.66 1.94l-1.05-.08c2 1.27 4.38 2.02 6.94 2.02 8.3 0 12.86-6.9 12.84-12.85.02-.24 0-.43 0-.65a8.68 8.68 0 0 0 2.26-2.34c-.82.38-1.7.62-2.6.72a4.37 4.37 0 0 0 1.95-2.51c-.84.53-1.81.9-2.83 1.13z\">\n             </path>\n            </svg>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"gg r an\">\n           <button class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gh gi bj bk fd fe\">\n            <svg class=\"q\" fill=\"none\" height=\"29\" viewbox=\"0 0 29 29\" width=\"29\">\n             <path d=\"M5 6.36C5 5.61 5.63 5 6.4 5h16.2c.77 0 1.4.61 1.4 1.36v16.28c0 .75-.63 1.36-1.4 1.36H6.4c-.77 0-1.4-.6-1.4-1.36V6.36z\">\n             </path>\n             <path clip-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M10.76 20.9v-8.57H7.89v8.58h2.87zm-1.44-9.75c1 0 1.63-.65 1.63-1.48-.02-.84-.62-1.48-1.6-1.48-.99 0-1.63.64-1.63 1.48 0 .83.62 1.48 1.59 1.48h.01zM12.35 20.9h2.87v-4.79c0-.25.02-.5.1-.7.2-.5.67-1.04 1.46-1.04 1.04 0 1.46.8 1.46 1.95v4.59h2.87v-4.92c0-2.64-1.42-3.87-3.3-3.87-1.55 0-2.23.86-2.61 1.45h.02v-1.24h-2.87c.04.8 0 8.58 0 8.58z\" fill=\"#fff\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n             </path>\n            </svg>\n           </button>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"gg r an\">\n           <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gh gi bj bk fd fe\" href=\"//medium.com/p/c52b92a7c73a/share/facebook?source=post_actions_footer---------------------------\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            <svg class=\"q\" height=\"29\" width=\"29\">\n             <path d=\"M23.2 5H5.8a.8.8 0 0 0-.8.8V23.2c0 .44.35.8.8.8h9.3v-7.13h-2.38V13.9h2.38v-2.38c0-2.45 1.55-3.66 3.74-3.66 1.05 0 1.95.08 2.2.11v2.57h-1.5c-1.2 0-1.48.57-1.48 1.4v1.96h2.97l-.6 2.97h-2.37l.05 7.12h5.1a.8.8 0 0 0 .79-.8V5.8a.8.8 0 0 0-.8-.79\">\n             </path>\n            </svg>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"mi r an\">\n           <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gh gi bj bk fd fe\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=register&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fmachine-learning-nlp-text-classification-using-scikit-learn-python-and-nltk-c52b92a7c73a&amp;source=post_actions_footer--------------------------bookmark_footer-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n            <svg height=\"25\" viewbox=\"0 0 25 25\" width=\"25\">\n             <path d=\"M19 6a2 2 0 0 0-2-2H8a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v14.66h.01c.01.1.05.2.12.28a.5.5 0 0 0 .7.03l5.67-4.12                 </path>\n                 <path clip-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M10.76 20.9v-8.57H7.89v8.58h2.87zm-1.44-9.75c1 0 1.63-.65 1.63-1.48-.02-.84-.62-1.48-1.6-1.48-.99 0-1.63.64-1.63 1.48 0 .83.62 1.48 1.59 1.48h.01zM12.35 20.9h2.87v-4.79c0-.25.02-.5.1-.7.2-.5.67-1.04 1.46-1.04 1.04 0 1.46.8 1.46 1.95v4.59h2.87v-4.92c0-2.64-1.42-3.87-3.3-3.87-1.55 0-2.23.86-2.61 1.45h.02v-1.24h-2.87c.04.8 0 8.58 0 8.58z\" fill=\"#fff\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </button>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gg r an\">\n               <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gh gi bj bk fd fe\" href=\"//medium.com/p/12f1e60e0a9f/share/facebook?source=post_actions_header---------------------------\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" 1.55-3.66 3.74-3.66 1.05 0 1.95.08 2.2.11v2.57h-1.5c-1.2 0-1.48.57-1.48 1.4v1.96h2.97l-.6 2.97h-2.37l.05 7.12h5.1a.8.8 0 0 0 .79-.8V5.8a.8.8 0 0 0-.8-.79\">\n                 </path>\n href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=register&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fmulti-class-text-classification-with-scikit-learn-12f1e60e0a9f&amp;source=post_actions_header--------------------------bookmark_header-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                <svg height=\"25\" viewbox=\"0 0 25 25\" width=\"25\">\n                 <path d=\"M19 6a2 2 0 0 0-2-2H8a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v14.66h.01c.01.1.05.2.12.28a.5.5 0 0 0 .7.03l5.67-4.12 5.66 4.13a.5.5 0 0 0 .71-.03.5.5 0 0 0 .12-.29H19V6zm-6.84 9.97L7 19.64V6a1 1 0 0 1 1-1h9a1 1 0 0 1 1 1v13.64l-5.16-3.67a.49.49 0 0 0-.68 0z\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gk r am\">\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"gl ai\">\n        <figure class=\"gm gn go gp gq gl ai paragraph-image\">\n         <div class=\"gw r gx gy\">\n          <div class=\"gz r\">\n           <div class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai br gu gv\">\n            <img class=\"s t u gt ai ha hb hc\" height=\"1280\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg?q=20\" width=\"1920\"/>\n           </div>\n           <img class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai hd\" height=\"1280\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1920px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2160/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1080w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2700/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1350w, https://miro.medium.com/max/3240/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1620w, https://miro.medium.com/max/3780/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1890w, https://miro.medium.com/max/3840/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1920w\" width=\"1920\"/>\n           <noscript>\n            <img class=\"s t u gt ai\" height=\"1280\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1920px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/3840/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2160/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1080w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2700/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1350w, https://miro.medium.com/max/3240/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1620w, https://miro.medium.com/max/3780/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1890w, https://miro.medium.com/max/3840/1*mdPG5HAPKDxL1J-QMxTDKg.jpeg 1920w\" width=\"1920\"/>\n           </noscript>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <figcaption class=\"av ew he hf hg de dc dd hh hi aq cl\">\n          Image credit: pexels\n         </figcaption>\n        </figure>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dq ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"ad57\">\n          There are lots of applications of text classification in the commercial world. For example, news stories are typically organized by topics; content or products are often tagged by categories; users can be classified into cohorts based on how they talk about a product or brand online \u2026\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"db81\">\n          However, the vast majority of text classification articles and tutorials on the internet are binary text classification such as email spam filtering (spam vs. ham), sentiment analysis (positive vs. negative). In most cases, our real world problem are much more complicated than that. Therefore, this is what we are going to do today: Classifying Consumer Finance Complaints into 12 pre-defined classes. The data can be downloaded from\n          <a class=\"cq fx hx hy hz ia\" href=\"https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/consumer-complaint-database\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           data.gov\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"5322\">\n          We use\n          <a class=\"cq fx hx hy hz ia\" href=\"https://www.python.org/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Python\n          </a>\n          and\n          <a class=\"cq fx hx hy hz ia\" href=\"http://jupyter.org/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Jupyter Notebook\n          </a>\n          to develop our system, relying on\n          <a class=\"cq fx hx hy hz ia\" href=\"http://scikit-learn.org/stable/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Scikit-Learn\n          </a>\n          for the machine learning components. If you would like to see an implementation in\n          <a class=\"cq fx hx hy hz ia\" href=\"https://spark.apache.org/docs/0.9.0/mllib-guide.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           PySpark\n          </a>\n          , read the\n          <a class=\"cq fx hx hy hz ia\" href=\"https://medium.com/@actsusanli/multi-class-text-classification-with-pyspark-7d78d022ed35\" rel=\"noopener\" target=\"_blank\">\n           next article\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"ib ic dt ar aq id dv ie dx if ig ih ii ij ik il im\" id=\"c190\">\n          Problem Formulation\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm in ho io hq ip hs iq hu ir hw dl\" id=\"a94f\">\n          The problem is supervised text classification problem, and our goal is to investigate which supervised machine learning methods are best suited to solve it.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"ce5d\">\n          Given a new complaint comes in, we want to assign it to one of 12 categories. The classifier makes the assumption that each new complaint is assigned to one and only one category. This is multi-class text classification problem. I can\u2019t wait to see what we can achieve!\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"ib ic dt ar aq id dv ie dx if ig ih ii ij ik il im\" id=\"5878\">\n          Data Exploration\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm in ho io hq ip hs iq hu ir hw dl\" id=\"c535\">\n          Before diving into training machine learning models, we should look at some examples first and the number of complaints in each class:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"56c5\">import pandas as pd<br/>df = pd.read_csv('Consumer_Complaints.csv')<br/>df.head()</span></pre>\n         <figure class=\"gm gn go gp gq gl dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"ja jb gx jc ai\">\n           <div class=\"dc dd iz\">\n            <div class=\"gw r gx gy\">\n             <div class=\"jd r\">\n              <div class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai br gu gv\">\n               <img class=\"s t u gt ai ha hb hc\" height=\"436\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png?q=20\" width=\"954\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai hd\" height=\"436\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png 700w\" width=\"954\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u gt ai\" height=\"436\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1908/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*88sJLbqhTHXbZIr9_ZvOXg.png 700w\" width=\"954\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av ew he hf hg de dc dd hh hi aq cl\">\n           Figure 1\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"888f\">\n          For this project, we need only two columns \u2014 \u201cProduct\u201d and \u201cConsumer complaint narrative\u201d.\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw je jf jg\" id=\"7d74\">\n           <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n            Input\n           </strong>\n           : Consumer_complaint_narrative\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"0a4d\">\n          Example: \u201c I have outdated information on my credit report that I have previously disputed that has yet to be removed this information is more then seven years old and does not meet credit reporting requirements\u201d\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw je jf jg\" id=\"264b\">\n           <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n            Output\n           </strong>\n           : product\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"14e5\">\n          Example: Credit reporting\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"6e42\">\n          We will remove missing values in \u201cConsumer complaints narrative\u201d column, and add a column encoding the product as an integer because categorical variables are often better represented by integers than strings.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"fc16\">\n          We also create a couple of dictionaries for future use.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"eab8\">\n          After cleaning up, this is the first five rows of the data we will be working on:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"f2ff\">from io import StringIO</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"cd13\">col = ['Product', 'Consumer complaint narrative']<br/>df = df[col]<br/>df = df[pd.notnull(df['Consumer complaint narrative'])]</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"7b35\">df.columns = ['Product', 'Consumer_complaint_narrative']</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"3aa5\">df['category_id'] = df['Product'].factorize()[0]<br/>category_id_df = df[['Product', 'category_id']].drop_duplicates().sort_values('category_id')<br/>category_to_id = dict(category_id_df.values)<br/>id_to_category = dict(category_id_df[['category_id', 'Product']].values)<br/>df.head()</span></pre>\n         <figure class=\"gm gn go gp gq gl dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"dc dd jn\">\n           <div class=\"gw r gx gy\">\n            <div class=\"jo r\">\n             <div class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai br gu gv\">\n              <img class=\"s t u gt ai ha hb hc\" height=\"177\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*6Gv_SJM_CaQHoDa2bcm92w.png?q=20\" width=\"509\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai hd\" height=\"177\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"509px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*6Gv_SJM_CaQHoDa2bcm92w.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1018/1*6Gv_SJM_CaQHoDa2bcm92w.png 509w\" width=\"509\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u gt ai\" height=\"177\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"509px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1018/1*6Gv_SJM_CaQHoDa2bcm92w.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*6Gv_SJM_CaQHoDa2bcm92w.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1018/1*6Gv_SJM_CaQHoDa2bcm92w.png 509w\" width=\"509\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av ew he hf hg de dc dd hh hi aq cl\">\n           Figure 2\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <h1 class=\"ib ic dt ar aq id dv ie dx if ig ih ii ij ik il im\" id=\"7373\">\n          Imbalanced Classes\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm in ho io hq ip hs iq hu ir hw dl\" id=\"cba2\">\n          We see that the number of complaints per product is imbalanced. Consumers\u2019 complaints are more biased towards Debt collection, Credit reporting and Mortgage.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"6209\">import matplotlib.pyplot as plt<br/>fig = plt.figure(figsize=(8,6))<br/>df.groupby('Product').Consumer_complaint_narrative.count().plot.bar(ylim=0)<br/>plt.show()</span></pre>\n         <figure class=\"gm gn go gp gq gl dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"dc dd jp\">\n           <div class=\"gw r gx gy\">\n            <div class=\"jq r\">\n             <div class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai br gu gv\">\n              <img class=\"s t u gt ai ha hb hc\" height=\"489\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*OQlJEad4CKFaWxOivngLxA.png?q=20\" width=\"556\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai hd\" height=\"489\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"556px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*OQlJEad4CKFaWxOivngLxA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*OQlJEad4CKFaWxOivngLxA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1112/1*OQlJEad4CKFaWxOivngLxA.png 556w\" width=\"556\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u gt ai\" height=\"489\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"556px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1112/1*OQlJEad4CKFaWxOivngLxA.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*OQlJEad4CKFaWxOivngLxA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*OQlJEad4CKFaWxOivngLxA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1112/1*OQlJEad4CKFaWxOivngLxA.png 556w\" width=\"556\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av ew he hf hg de dc dd hh hi aq cl\">\n           Figure 3\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"c477\">\n          When we encounter such problems, we are bound to have difficulties solving them with standard algorithms. Conventional algorithms are often biased towards the majority class, not taking the data distribution into consideration. In the worst case, minority classes are treated as outliers and ignored. For some cases, such as fraud detection or cancer prediction, we would need to carefully configure our model or artificially balance the dataset, for example by\n          <a class=\"cq fx hx hy hz ia\" href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oversampling_and_undersampling_in_data_analysis\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           undersampling or oversampling\n          </a>\n          each class.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"726a\">\n          However, in our case of learning imbalanced data, the majority classes might be of our great interest. It is desirable to have a classifier that gives high prediction accuracy over the majority class, while maintaining reasonable accuracy for the minority classes. Therefore, we will leave it as it is.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"ib ic dt ar aq id dv ie dx if ig ih ii ij ik il im\" id=\"783f\">\n          Text Representation\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm in ho io hq ip hs iq hu ir hw dl\" id=\"13c2\">\n          The classifiers and learning algorithms can not directly process the text documents in their original form, as most of them expect numerical feature vectors with a fixed size rather than the raw text documents with variable length. Therefore, during the preprocessing step, the texts are converted to a more manageable representation.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"52f6\">\n          One common approach for extracting features from text is to use the bag of words model: a model where for each document, a complaint narrative in our case, the presence (and often the frequency) of words is taken into consideration, but the order in which they occur is ignored.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"aa59\">\n          Specifically, for each term in our dataset, we will calculate a measure called Term Frequency, Inverse Document Frequency, abbreviated to tf-idf. We will use\n          <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n           sklearn.feature_extraction.text.TfidfVectorizer\n          </code>\n          to calculate a\n          <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n           tf-idf\n          </code>\n          vector for each of consumer complaint narratives:\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw je jf jg\" id=\"5f86\">\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            sublinear_df\n           </code>\n           is set to\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            True\n           </code>\n           to use a logarithmic form for frequency.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm ju ho jv hq jw hs jx hu jy hw je jf jg\" id=\"5d22\">\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            min_df\n           </code>\n           is the minimum numbers of documents a word must be present in to be kept.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm ju ho jv hq jw hs jx hu jy hw je jf jg\" id=\"9a28\">\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            norm\n           </code>\n           is set to\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            l2\n           </code>\n           , to ensure all our feature vectors have a euclidian norm of 1.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm ju ho jv hq jw hs jx hu jy hw je jf jg\" id=\"bd89\">\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            ngram_range\n           </code>\n           is set to\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            (1, 2)\n           </code>\n           to indicate that we want to consider both unigrams and bigrams.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm ju ho jv hq jw hs jx hu jy hw je jf jg\" id=\"e197\">\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            stop_words\n           </code>\n           is set to\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            \"english\"\n           </code>\n           to remove all common pronouns (\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            \"a\"\n           </code>\n           ,\n           <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n            \"the\"\n           </code>\n           , ...) to reduce the number of noisy features.\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"b8f6\">from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import TfidfVectorizer</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"e172\">tfidf = TfidfVectorizer(sublinear_tf=True, min_df=5, norm='l2', encoding='latin-1', ngram_range=(1, 2), stop_words='english')</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"bbe5\">features = tfidf.fit_transform(df.Consumer_complaint_narrative).toarray()<br/>labels = df.category_id<br/>features.shape</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"3076\">\n          (4569, 12633)\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"1f07\">\n          Now, each of 4569 consumer complaint narratives is represented by 12633 features, representing the tf-idf score for different unigrams and bigrams.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"70e0\">\n          We can use\n          <code class=\"gy jr js jt iv b\">\n           sklearn.feature_selection.chi2\n          </code>\n          to find the terms that are the most correlated with each of the products:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"17ea\">from sklearn.feature_selection import chi2<br/>import numpy as np</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"954c\">N = 2<br/>for Product, category_id in sorted(category_to_id.items()):<br/>  features_chi2 = chi2(features, labels == category_id)<br/>  indices = np.argsort(features_chi2[0])<br/>  feature_names = np.array(tfidf.get_feature_names())[indices]<br/>  unigrams = [v for v in feature_names if len(v.split(' ')) == 1]<br/>  bigrams = [v for v in feature_names if len(v.split(' ')) == 2]<br/>  print(\"# '{}':\".format(Product))<br/>  print(\"  . Most correlated unigrams:\\n. {}\".format('\\n. '.join(unigrams[-N:])))<br/>  print(\"  . Most correlated bigrams:\\n. {}\".format('\\n. '.join(bigrams[-N:])))</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"a904\">\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Bank account or service\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . bank\n          <br/>\n          . overdraft\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . overdraft fees\n          <br/>\n          . checking account\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Consumer Loan\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . car\n          <br/>\n          . vehicle\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . vehicle xxxx\n          <br/>\n          . toyota financial\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Credit card\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . citi\n          <br/>\n          . card\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . annual fee\n          <br/>\n          . credit card\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Credit reporting\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . experian\n          <br/>\n          . equifax\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . trans union\n          <br/>\n          . credit report\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Debt collection\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . collection\n          <br/>\n          . debt\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . collect debt\n          <br/>\n          . collection agency\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Money transfers\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . wu\n          <br/>\n          . paypal\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . western union\n          <br/>\n          . money transfer\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Mortgage\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . modification\n          <br/>\n          . mortgage\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . mortgage company\n          <br/>\n          . loan modification\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Other financial service\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . dental\n          <br/>\n          . passport\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . help pay\n          <br/>\n          . stated pay\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Payday loan\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . borrowed\n          <br/>\n          . payday\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . big picture\n          <br/>\n          . payday loan\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Prepaid card\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . serve\n          <br/>\n          . prepaid\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . access money\n          <br/>\n          . prepaid card\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Student loan\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . student\n          <br/>\n          . navient\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . student loans\n          <br/>\n          . student loan\n          <br/>\n          # \u2018\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           Virtual currency\n          </strong>\n          \u2019:\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated unigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . handles\n          <br/>\n          . https\n          <br/>\n          . Most correlated bigrams:\n          <br/>\n          . xxxx provider\n          <br/>\n          . money want\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"c4f6\">\n          They all make sense, don\u2019t you think so?\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"iu ic dt ar aq id jz ka kb kc kd ke kf kg kh ki kj\" id=\"e4a5\">\n          Multi-Class Classifier: Features and Design\n         </h2>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm in ho io hq ip hs iq hu ir hw je jf jg\" id=\"6ace\">\n           To train supervised classifiers, we first transformed the \u201cConsumer complaint narrative\u201d into a vector of numbers. We explored vector representations such as TF-IDF weighted vectors.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm ju ho jv hq jw hs jx hu jy hw je jf jg\" id=\"ead6\">\n           After having this vector representations of the text we can train supervised classifiers to train unseen \u201cConsumer complaint narrative\u201d and predict the \u201cproduct\u201d on which they fall.\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"a3e4\">\n          After all the above data transformation, now that we have all the features and labels, it is time to train the classifiers. There are a number of algorithms we can use for this type of problem.\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw je jf jg\" id=\"ac83\">\n           <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n            Naive Bayes Classifier\n           </strong>\n           : the one most suitable for word counts is the multinomial variant:\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"ddc6\">from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split<br/>from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import CountVectorizer<br/>from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import TfidfTransformer<br/>from sklearn.naive_bayes import MultinomialNB</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"3f3d\">X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(df['Consumer_complaint_narrative'], df['Product'], random_state = 0)<br/>count_vect = CountVectorizer()<br/>X_train_counts = count_vect.fit_transform(X_train)<br/>tfidf_transformer = TfidfTransformer()<br/>X_train_tfidf = tfidf_transformer.fit_transform(X_train_counts)</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"815b\">clf = MultinomialNB().fit(X_train_tfidf, y_train)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"f107\">\n          After fitting the training set, let\u2019s make some predictions.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"6aba\">print(clf.predict(count_vect.transform([\"This company refuses to provide me verification and validation of debt per my right under the FDCPA. I do not believe this debt is mine.\"])))</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"b538\">\n          [\u2018Debt collection\u2019]\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"cda7\">df[df['Consumer_complaint_narrative'] == \"This company refuses to provide me verification and validation of debt per my right under the FDCPA. I do not believe this debt is mine.\"]</span></pre>\n         <figure class=\"gm gn go gp gq gl dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"ja jb gx jc ai\">\n           <div class=\"dc dd kk\">\n            <div class=\"gw r gx gy\">\n             <div class=\"kl r\">\n              <div class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai br gu gv\">\n               <img class=\"s t u gt ai ha hb hc\" height=\"63\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*Kh4tNh4c_RWWfWtUB_BRcg.png?q=20\" width=\"491\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai hd\" height=\"63\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"491px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*Kh4tNh4c_RWWfWtUB_BRcg.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/982/1*Kh4tNh4c_RWWfWtUB_BRcg.png 491w\" width=\"491\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u gt ai\" height=\"63\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"491px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/982/1*Kh4tNh4c_RWWfWtUB_BRcg.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*Kh4tNh4c_RWWfWtUB_BRcg.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/982/1*Kh4tNh4c_RWWfWtUB_BRcg.png 491w\" width=\"491\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av ew he hf hg de dc dd hh hi aq cl\">\n           Figure 4\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"b988\">print(clf.predict(count_vect.transform([\"I am disputing the inaccurate information the Chex-Systems has on my credit report. id=\"2881\">\n          Model Selection\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm in ho io hq ip hs iq hu ir hw dl\" id=\"156e\">\n          We are now ready to experiment with different machine learning models, evaluate their accuracy and find the source of any potential issues.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"790a\">\n          We will benchmark the following four models:\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw je jf jg\" id=\"9d9d\">\n           Logistic Regression\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm ju ho jv hq jw hs jx hu jy hw je jf jg\" id=\"db34\">\n           (Multinomial) Naive Bayes\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm ju ho jv hq jw hs jx hu jy hw je jf jg\" id=\"70e2\">\n           Linear Support Vector Machine\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm ju ho jv hq jw hs jx hu jy hw je jf jg\" id=\"dc8e\">\n           Random Forest\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <pre class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"f681\">from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression<br/>from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier<br/>from sklearn.svm import LinearSVC</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"3ed0\">from sklearn.model_selection import cross_val_score</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"418c\">models = [<br/>    RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=200, max_depth=3, random_state=0),<br/>    LinearSVC(),<br/>    MultinomialNB(),<br/>    LogisticRegression(random_state=0),<br/>]<br/>CV = 5<br/>cv_df = pd.DataFrame(index=range(CV * len(models)))<br/>entries = []<br/>for model in models:<br/>  model_name = model.__class__.__name__<br/>  accuracies = cross_val_score(model, features, labels, scoring='accuracy', cv=CV)<br/>  for fold_idx, accuracy in enumerate(accuracies):<br/>    entries.append((model_name, fold_idx, accuracy))<br/>cv_df = pd.DataFrame(entries, columns=['model_name', 'fold_idx', 'accuracy'])</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"4777\">import seaborn as sns</span><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew ji jj jk jl jm ix r iy\" id=\"f01c\">sns.boxplot(x='model_name', y='accuracy', data=cv_df)<br/>sns.stripplot(x='model_name', y='accuracy', data=cv_df, <br/>              size=8, jitter=True, edgecolor=\"gray\", linewidth=2)<br/>plt.show()</span></pre>\n         <figure class=\"gm gn go gp gq gl dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"dc dd ko\">\n           <div class=\"gw r gx gy\">\n            <div class=\"kp r\">\n             <div class=\"gr gs s t u gt ai br gu gv\">\n              <img class=\"s t u gt ai ha hb hc\" height=\"279\" role=\"presentation\" class=\"gm gn go gp gq is it ca\"><span class=\"iu ic dt ar iv b ew iw ix r iy\" id=\"6825\">cv_df.groupby('model_name').accuracy.mean()</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hj hk dt ar hl b hm hn ho hp hq hr hs ht hu hv hw dl\" id=\"740d\">\n          model_name\n          <br/>\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           LinearSVC:\n          </strong>\n          0.822890\n          <br/>\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           LogisticRegression:\n          </strong>\n          0.792927\n          <br/>\n          <strong class=\"hl jh\">\n           MultinomialNB:\n
