https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*r54-L9t14gqTbI6IlrW2wA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*r54-L9t14gqTbI6IlrW2wA.png 700w\" width=\"2000\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"ci ez hx hy hz cq co cp ia ib cd dx\">\n           Unfortunately we don\u2019t live in this alternate version of history where all data is\n           <em class=\"ic\">\n            structured\n           </em>\n           .\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"6332\">\n          A lot of information in the world is unstructured \u2014 raw text in English or another human language. How can we get a computer to understand unstructured text and extract data from it?\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"hg\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"id ie if ig ih ii ae ij af ik ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg il im paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"co cp ag\">\n            <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n             <div class=\"in r\">\n              <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"287\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/freeze/max/60/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif?q=20\" width=\"1000\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"287\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 1000w\" width=\"1000\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"287\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*CtR2lIHDkhB9M8Jt4irSyg.gif 1000w\" width=\"1000\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dc ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"d29b\">\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           Natural Language Processing\n          </em>\n          , or\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           NLP\n          </em>\n          , is the sub-field of AI that is focused on enabling computers to understand and process human languages. Let\u2019s check out how NLP works and learn how to write programs that can extract information out of raw text using Python!\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"f705\">\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           Note: If you don\u2019t care how NLP works and just want to cut and paste some code, skip way down to the section called \u201cCoding the NLP Pipeline in Python\u201d.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"io ip ap ce cd iq dg ir di is it iu iv iw ix iy iz\" id=\"8088\">\n          Can Computers Understand Language?\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"211c\">\n          As long as computers have been around, programmers have been trying to write programs that understand languages like English. The reason is pretty obvious \u2014 humans have been writing things down for thousands of years and it would be really helpful if a computer could read and understand all that data.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"579f\">\n          Computers can\u2019t yet truly understand English in the way that humans do \u2014 but they can already do a lot! In certain limited areas, what you can do with NLP already seems like magic. You might be able to save a lot of time by applying NLP techniques to your own projects.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"aea4\">\n          And even better, the latest advances in NLP are easily accessible through open source Python libraries like\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://spacy.io/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           spaCy\n          </a>\n          ,\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"http://textacy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           textacy\n          </a>\n          , and\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://github.com/huggingface/neuralcoref\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           neuralcoref\n          </a>\n          . What you can do with just a few lines of python is amazing.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"io ip ap ce cd iq dg ir di is it iu iv iw ix iy iz\" id=\"1fcd\">\n          Extracting Meaning from Text is Hard\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"bedf\">\n          The process of reading and understanding English is very complex \u2014 and that\u2019s not even considering that English doesn\u2019t follow logical and consistent rules. For example, what does this news headline mean?\n         </p>\n         <blockquote class=\"jf jg jh\">\n          <p class=\"gi gj ap gu gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"7b5e\">\n           \u201cEnvironmental regulators grill business owner over illegal coal fires.\u201d\n          </p>\n         </blockquote>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"a9bf\">\n          Are the regulators questioning a business owner about burning coal illegally? Or are the regulators literally cooking the business owner? As you can see, parsing English with a computer is going to be complicated.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"9e82\">\n          Doing anything complicated in machine learning usually means\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           building a pipeline\n          </em>\n          . The idea is to break up your problem into very small pieces and then use machine learning to solve each smaller piece separately. Then by chaining together several machine learning models that feed into each other, you can do very complicated things.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"99fc\">\n          And that\u2019s exactly the strategy we are going to use for NLP. We\u2019ll break down the process of understanding English into small chunks and see how each one works.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"io ip ap ce cd iq dg ir di is it iu iv iw ix iy iz\" id=\"0beb\">\n          Building an NLP Pipeline, Step-by-Step\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"dfe2\">\n          Let\u2019s look at a piece of text from Wikipedia:\n         </p>\n         <blockquote class=\"jf jg jh\">\n          <p class=\"gi gj ap gu gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"c467\">\n           London is the capital and most populous city of England and the United Kingdom. Standing on the River Thames in the south east of the island of Great Britain, London has been a major settlement for two millennia. It was founded by the Romans, who named it Londinium.\n          </p>\n          <p class=\"gi gj ap gu gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"335f\">\n           (Source:\n           <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            Wikipedia article \u201cLondon\u201d\n           </a>\n           )\n          </p>\n         </blockquote>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"0da5\">\n          This paragraph contains several useful facts. It would be great if a computer could read this text and understand that London is a city, London is located in England, London was settled by Romans and so on. But to get there, we have to first teach our computer the most basic concepts of written language and then move up from there.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"1ecd\">\n          Step 1: Sentence Segmentation\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"b1f3\">\n          The first step in the pipeline is to break the text apart into separate sentences. That gives us this:\n         </p>\n         <ol class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt ju jv jw\" id=\"fba5\">\n           \u201cLondon is the capital and most populous city of England and the United Kingdom.\u201d\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy jx ea jy gn jz gp ka gr kb gt ju jv jw\" id=\"456a\">\n           \u201cStanding on the River Thames in the south east of the island of Great Britain, London has been a major settlement for two millennia.\u201d\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy jx ea jy gn jz gp ka gr kb gt ju jv jw\" id=\"7b72\">\n           \u201cIt was founded by the Romans, who named it Londinium.\u201d\n          </li>\n         </ol>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"03d4\">\n          We can assume that each sentence in English is a separate thought or idea. It will be a lot easier to write a program to understand a single sentence than to understand a whole paragraph.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"8a8f\">\n          Coding a Sentence Segmentation model can be as simple as splitting apart sentences whenever you see a punctuation mark. But modern NLP pipelines often use more complex techniques that work even when a document isn\u2019t formatted cleanly.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"19ce\">\n          Step 2: Word Tokenization\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"c63d\">\n          Now that we\u2019ve split our document into sentences, we can process them one at a time. Let\u2019s start with the first sentence from our document:\n         </p>\n         <blockquote class=\"jf jg jh\">\n          <p class=\"gi gj ap gu gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"c105\">\n           \u201cLondon is the capital and most populous city of England and the United Kingdom.\u201d\n          </p>\n         </blockquote>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"250d\">\n          The next step in our pipeline is to break this sentence into separate words or\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           tokens\n          </em>\n          . This is called\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           tokenization\n          </em>\n          . This is the result:\n         </p>\n         <blockquote class=\"jf jg jh\">\n          <p class=\"gi gj ap gu gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"482f\">\n           \u201cLondon\u201d, \u201cis\u201d, \u201c the\u201d, \u201ccapital\u201d, \u201cand\u201d, \u201cmost\u201d, \u201cpopulous\u201d, \u201ccity\u201d, \u201cof\u201d, \u201cEngland\u201d, \u201cand\u201d, \u201cthe\u201d, \u201cUnited\u201d, \u201cKingdom\u201d, \u201c.\u201d\n          </p>\n         </blockquote>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"a542\">\n          Tokenization is easy to do in English. We\u2019ll just split apart words whenever there\u2019s a space between them. And we\u2019ll also treat punctuation marks as separate tokens since punctuation also has meaning.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"ca86\">\n          Step 3: Predicting Parts of Speech for Each Token\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"931f\">\n          Next, we\u2019ll look at each token and try to guess its part of speech \u2014 whether it is a noun, a verb, an adjective and so on. Knowing the role of each word in the sentence will help us start to figure out what the sentence is talking about.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"6980\">\n          We can do this by feeding each word (and some extra words around it for context) into a pre-trained part-of-speech classification model:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg co cp paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n           <div class=\"co cp kc\">\n            <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n             <div class=\"kd r\">\n              <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"254\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png?q=20\" width=\"1029\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"254\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png 700w\" width=\"1029\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"254\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2058/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*u7Z1B1TIYe68V8lS2f8GNg.png 700w\" width=\"1029\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"a946\">\n          The part-of-speech model was originally trained by feeding it millions of English sentences with each word\u2019s part of speech already tagged and having it learn to replicate that behavior.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"bf1c\">\n          Keep in mind that the model is completely based on statistics \u2014 it doesn\u2019t actually understand what the words mean in the same way that humans do. It just knows how to guess a part of speech based on similar sentences and words it has seen before.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"fa39\">\n          After processing the whole sentence, we\u2019ll have a result like this:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"hg\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"id ie if ig ih ii ae ij af ik ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg il im paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n            <div class=\"co cp ke\">\n             <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n              <div class=\"kf r\">\n               <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"131\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png?q=20\" width=\"1218\"/>\n               </div>\n               <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"131\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 1000w\" width=\"1218\"/>\n               <noscript>\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"131\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2436/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*O0gIbvPd-weZw4IGmA5ywQ.png 1000w\" width=\"1218\"/>\n               </noscript>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dc ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"b509\">\n          With this information, we can already start to glean some very basic meaning. For example, we can see that the nouns in the sentence include \u201cLondon\u201d and \u201ccapital\u201d, so the sentence is probably talking about London.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"dbd8\">\n          Step 4: Text Lemmatization\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"4c1e\">\n          In English (and most languages), words appear in different forms. Look at these two sentences:\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"8134\">\n          I had a\n          <strong class=\"gk gz\">\n           pony\n          </strong>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"ce0a\">\n          I had two\n          <strong class=\"gk gz\">\n           ponies\n          </strong>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"0335\">\n          Both sentences talk about the noun\n          <strong class=\"gk gz\">\n           pony,\n          </strong>\n          but they are using different inflections. When working with text in a computer, it is helpful to know the base form of each word so that you know that both sentences are talking about the same concept. Otherwise the strings \u201cpony\u201d and \u201cponies\u201d look like two totally different words to a computer.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"e4e9\">\n          In NLP, we call finding this process\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           lemmatization\n          </em>\n          \u2014 figuring out the most basic form or\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           lemma\n          </em>\n          of each word in the sentence.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"f643\">\n          The same thing applies to verbs. We can also lemmatize verbs by finding their root, unconjugated form. So \u201c\n          <strong class=\"gk gz\">\n           I had two ponies\n          </strong>\n          \u201d becomes \u201c\n          <strong class=\"gk gz\">\n           I [have] two [pony].\n          </strong>\n          \u201d\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"3ca5\">\n          Lemmatization is typically done by having a look-up table of the lemma forms of words based on their part of speech and possibly having some custom rules to handle words that you\u2019ve never seen before.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"e59e\">\n          Here\u2019s what our sentence looks like after lemmatization adds in the root form of our verb:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"hg\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"id ie if ig ih ii ae ij af ik ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg il im paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n            <div class=\"co cp ke\">\n             <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n              <div class=\"kg r\">\n               <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png?q=20\" width=\"1218\"/>\n               </div>\n               <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 1000w\" width=\"1218\"/>\n               <noscript>\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2436/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 1000w\" width=\"1218\"/>\n               </noscript>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dc ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"f5cf\">\n          The only change we made was turning \u201cis\u201d into \u201cbe\u201d.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"9d54\">\n          Step 5: Identifying Stop Words\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"84d5\">\n          Next, we want to consider the importance of a each word in the sentence. English has a lot of filler words that appear very frequently like \u201cand\u201d, \u201cthe\u201d, and \u201ca\u201d. When doing statistics on text, these words introduce a lot of noise since they appear way more frequently than other words. Some NLP pipelines will flag them as\n          <strong class=\"gk gz\">\n           stop words\n          </strong>\n          \u2014that is, words that you might want to filter out before doing any statistical analysis.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"40d1\">\n          Here\u2019s how our sentence looks with the stop words grayed out:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"hg\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"id ie if ig ih ii ae ij af ik ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg il im paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n            <div class=\"co cp ke\">\n             <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n              <div class=\"kg r\">\n               <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png?q=20\" width=\"1218\"/>\n               </div>\n               <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 1000w\" width=\"1218\"/>\n               <noscript>\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2436/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*Zgq1nK_71AzX1CaknB89Ww.png 1000w\" width=\"1218\"/>\n               </noscript>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dc ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"a264\">\n          Stop words are usually identified by just by checking a hardcoded list of known stop words. But there\u2019s no standard list of stop words that is appropriate for all applications. The list of words to ignore can vary depending on your application.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"3248\">\n          For example if you are building a rock band search engine, you want to make sure you don\u2019t ignore the word \u201cThe\u201d. Because not only does the word \u201cThe\u201d appear in a lot of band names, there\u2019s a famous 1980\u2019s rock band called\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           The The\n          </em>\n          !\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"f820\">\n          Step 6: Dependency Parsing\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"0a5d\">\n          The next step is to figure out how all the words in our sentence relate to each other. This is called\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           dependency parsing\n          </em>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"4bc9\">\n          The goal is to build a tree that assigns a single\n          <strong class=\"gk gz\">\n           parent\n          </strong>\n          word to each word in the sentence. The root of the tree will be the main verb in the sentence. Here\u2019s what the beginning of the parse tree will look like for our sentence:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg co cp paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n           <div class=\"co cp kh\">\n            <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n             <div class=\"ki r\">\n              <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"781\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png?q=20\" width=\"1287\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"781\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png 700w\" width=\"1287\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"781\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2574/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*nteaQRxNNSXMlAnT31iXjw.png 700w\" width=\"1287\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"7ee4\">\n          But we can go one step further. In addition to identifying the parent word of each word, we can also predict the type of relationship that exists between those two words:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg co cp paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n           <div class=\"co cp kh\">\n            <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n             <div class=\"ki r\">\n              <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"781\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png?q=20\" width=\"1287\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"781\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png 700w\" width=\"1287\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"781\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2574/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*onc_4Mnq2L7cetMAowYAbA.png 700w\" width=\"1287\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"a1b8\">\n          This parse tree shows us that the subject of the sentence is the noun \u201c\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           London\n          </em>\n          \u201d and it has a \u201c\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           be\n          </em>\n          \u201d relationship with \u201c\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           capital\n          </em>\n          \u201d. We finally know something useful \u2014\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           London\n          </em>\n          is a\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           capital\n          </em>\n          ! And if we followed the complete parse tree for the sentence (beyond what is shown), we would even found out that London is the capital of the\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           United Kingdom\n          </em>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"95cf\">\n          Just like how we predicted parts of speech earlier using a machine learning model, dependency parsing also works by feeding words into a machine learning model and outputting a result. But parsing word dependencies is particularly complex task and would require an entire article to explain in any detail. If you are curious how it works, a great place to start reading is Matthew Honnibal\u2019s excellent article\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           \u201c\n          </em>\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://explosion.ai/blog/parsing-english-in-python\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <em class=\"gu\">\n            Parsing English in 500 Lines of Python\n           </em>\n          </a>\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           \u201d\n          </em>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"81e6\">\n          But despite a note from the author in 2015 saying that this approach is now standard, it\u2019s actually out of date and not even used by the author anymore. In 2016, Google released a new dependency parser called\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           Parsey McParseface\n          </em>\n          which outperformed previous benchmarks using a new deep learning approach which quickly spread throughout the industry. Then a year later, they released an even newer model called\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           ParseySaurus\n          </em>\n          which improved things further. In other words, parsing techniques are still an active area of research and constantly changing and improving.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"2447\">\n          It\u2019s also important to remember that many English sentences are ambiguous and just really hard to parse. In those cases, the model will make a guess based on what parsed version of the sentence seems most likely but it\u2019s not perfect and sometimes the model will be embarrassingly wrong\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           .\n          </em>\n          But over time our NLP models will continue to get better at parsing text in a sensible way.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"9132\">\n          Want to try out dependency parsing on your own sentence?\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://explosion.ai/demos/displacy\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           There\u2019s a great interactive demo from the spaCy team here\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"15b7\">\n          Step 6b: Finding Noun Phrases\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"41fa\">\n          So far, we\u2019ve treated every word in our sentence as a separate entity. But sometimes it makes more sense to group together the words that represent a single idea or thing. We can use the information from the dependency parse tree to automatically group together words that are all talking about the same thing.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"2e0c\">\n          For example, instead of this:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg co cp paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n           <div class=\"co cp ke\">\n            <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n             <div class=\"kg r\">\n              <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png?q=20\" width=\"1218\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 700w\" width=\"1218\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2436/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*EgYJsyjBNk074TQf87_CqA.png 700w\" width=\"1218\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"e9a0\">\n          We can group the noun phrases to generate this:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg co cp paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n           <div class=\"co cp kj\">\n            <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n             <div class=\"kk r\">\n              <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png?q=20\" width=\"987\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png 700w\" width=\"987\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"187\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1974/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*5dlHkuUP3pG8ktlR-wPliw.png 700w\" width=\"987\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"9edd\">\n          Whether or not we do this step depends on our end goal. But it\u2019s often a quick and easy way to simplify the sentence if we don\u2019t need extra detail about which words are adjectives and instead care more about extracting complete ideas.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"b740\">\n          Step 7: Named Entity Recognition (NER)\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"e8db\">\n          Now that we\u2019ve done all that hard work, we can finally move beyond grade-school grammar and start actually extracting ideas.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"46bf\">\n          In our sentence, we have the following nouns:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"hg\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"id ie if ig ih ii ae ij af ik ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg il im paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n            <div class=\"co cp ag\">\n             <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n              <div class=\"kl r\">\n               <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"45\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png?q=20\" width=\"1104\"/>\n               </div>\n               <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"45\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 1000w\" width=\"1104\"/>\n               <noscript>\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"45\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2208/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*JMXGOrdx4oQsfZC5t-Ksgw.png 1000w\" width=\"1104\"/>\n               </noscript>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dc ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"8ebc\">\n          Some of these nouns present real things in the world. For example, \u201c\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           London\u201d\n          </em>\n          ,\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           \u201cEngland\u201d\n          </em>\n          and\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           \u201cUnited Kingdom\u201d\n          </em>\n          represent physical places on a map. It would be nice to be able to detect that! With that information, we could automatically extract a list of real-world places mentioned in a document using NLP.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"000b\">\n          The goal of\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           Named Entity Recognition\n          </em>\n          , or\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           NER\n          </em>\n          , is to detect and label these nouns with the real-world concepts that they represent. Here\u2019s what our sentence looks like after running each token through our NER tagging model:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"hg\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"id ie if ig ih ii ae ij af ik ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg il im paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n            <div class=\"co cp ag\">\n             <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n              <div class=\"km r\">\n               <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"143\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png?q=20\" width=\"1131\"/>\n               </div>\n               <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"143\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 1000w\" width=\"1131\"/>\n               <noscript>\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"143\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2262/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*x1kwwACli8Fcvjos_6oS-A.png 1000w\" width=\"1131\"/>\n               </noscript>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dc ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"8b58\">\n          But NER systems aren\u2019t just doing a simple dictionary lookup. Instead, they are using the context of how a word appears in the sentence and a statistical model to guess which type of noun a word represents. A good NER system can tell the difference between \u201c\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           Brooklyn Decker\n          </em>\n          \u201d the person and the place \u201c\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           Brooklyn\n          </em>\n          \u201d using context clues.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"e951\">\n          Here are just some of the kinds of objects that a typical NER system can tag:\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt kn jv jw\" id=\"a731\">\n           People\u2019s names\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy jx ea jy gn jz gp ka gr kb gt kn jv jw\" id=\"fa07\">\n           Company names\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy jx ea jy gn jz gp ka gr kb gt kn jv jw\" id=\"70b0\">\n           Geographic locations (Both physical and political)\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy jx ea jy gn jz gp ka gr kb gt kn jv jw\" id=\"0929\">\n           Product names\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy jx ea jy gn jz gp ka gr kb gt kn jv jw\" id=\"077e\">\n           Dates and times\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy jx ea jy gn jz gp ka gr kb gt kn jv jw\" id=\"a7f2\">\n           Amounts of money\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy jx ea jy gn jz gp ka gr kb gt kn jv jw\" id=\"61be\">\n           Names of events\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"580d\">\n          NER has tons of uses since it makes it so easy to grab structured data out of text. It\u2019s one of the easiest ways to quickly get value out of an NLP pipeline.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"7ced\">\n          Want to try out Named Entity Recognition yourself?\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://explosion.ai/demos/displacy-ent\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           There\u2019s another great interactive demo from spaCy here\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"9ce5\">\n          Step 8: Coreference Resolution\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"ac44\">\n          At this point, we already have a useful representation of our sentence. We know the parts of speech for each word, how the words relate to each other and which words are talking about named entities.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"a878\">\n          However, we still have one big problem. English is full of pronouns \u2014 words like\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           he\n          </em>\n          ,\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           she\n          </em>\n          , and\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           it\n          </em>\n          . These are shortcuts that we use instead of writing out names over and over in each sentence. Humans can keep track of what these words represent based on context. But our NLP model doesn\u2019t know what pronouns mean because it only examines one sentence at a time.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"63b6\">\n          Let\u2019s look at the third sentence in our document:\n         </p>\n         <blockquote class=\"jf jg jh\">\n          <p class=\"gi gj ap gu gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"f93f\">\n           \u201cIt was founded by the Romans, who named it Londinium.\u201d\n          </p>\n         </blockquote>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"6228\">\n          If we parse this with our NLP pipeline, we\u2019ll know that \u201cit\u201d was founded by Romans. But it\u2019s a lot more useful to know that \u201cLondon\u201d was founded by Romans.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"aabf\">\n          As a human reading this sentence, you can easily figure out that \u201c\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           it\u201d\n          </em>\n          means \u201c\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           London\u201d\n          </em>\n          . The goal of coreference resolution is to figure out this same mapping by tracking pronouns across sentences. We want to figure out all the words that are referring to the same entity.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"e5db\">\n          Here\u2019s the result of running coreference resolution on our document for the word \u201cLondon\u201d:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg co cp paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n           <div class=\"co cp ko\">\n            <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n             <div class=\"kp r\">\n              <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"304\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png?q=20\" width=\"937\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"304\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png 700w\" width=\"937\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"304\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1874/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*vGPbWiJqQA65GlwcOYtbKQ.png 700w\" width=\"937\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"c0ec\">\n          With coreference information combined with the parse tree and named entity information, we should be able to extract a lot of information out of this document!\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"60c1\">\n          Coreference resolution is one of the most difficult steps in our pipeline to implement. It\u2019s even more difficult than sentence parsing. Recent advances in deep learning have resulted in new approaches that are more accurate, but it isn\u2019t perfect yet. If you want to learn more about how it works,\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"/huggingface/state-of-the-art-neural-coreference-resolution-for-chatbots-3302365dcf30\" rel=\"noopener\" target=\"_blank\">\n           start here\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"9c27\">\n          Want to play with co-reference resolution?\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://huggingface.co/coref/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Check out this great co-reference resolution demo from Hugging Face\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"io ip ap ce cd iq dg ir di is it iu iv iw ix iy iz\" id=\"2970\">\n          Coding the NLP Pipeline in Python\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"589b\">\n          Here\u2019s an overview of our complete NLP pipeline:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"hg\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"id ie if ig ih ii ae ij af ik ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg il im paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n            <div class=\"co cp kq\">\n             <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n              <div class=\"kr r\">\n               <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"333\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png?q=20\" width=\"2152\"/>\n               </div>\n               <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"333\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 1000w\" width=\"2152\"/>\n               <noscript>\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"333\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/4304/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*zHLs87sp8R61ehUoXepWHA.png 1000w\" width=\"2152\"/>\n               </noscript>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n           <figcaption class=\"ci ez hx hy hz cq co cp ia ib cd dx\">\n            Coreference resolution is an optional step that isn\u2019t always done.\n           </figcaption>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dc ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"453c\">\n          Whew, that\u2019s a lot of steps!\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"7f97\">\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           Note: Before we continue, it\u2019s worth mentioning that these are the steps in a typical NLP pipeline, but you will skip steps or re-order steps depending on what you want to do and how your NLP library is implemented. For example, some libraries like spaCy do sentence segmentation much later in the pipeline using the results of the dependency parse.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"07ea\">\n          So how do we code this pipeline? Thanks to amazing python libraries like spaCy, it\u2019s already done! The steps are all coded and ready for you to use.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"3d1f\">\n          First, assuming you have Python 3 installed already, you can install spaCy like this:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg\">\n          <div class=\"hq r hj\">\n           <div class=\"ks r\">\n            <iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"s t u hn ai\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" src=\"https://medium.com/media/96006cefafa7bc76e45c4eb09138de24\" title=\"Install spacy.txt\" width=\"0\">\n            </iframe>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"6502\">\n          Then the code to run an NLP pipeline on a piece of text looks like this:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg\">\n          <div class=\"hq r hj\">\n           <div class=\"ks r\">\n            <iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"s t u hn ai\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" src=\"https://medium.com/media/8e8b1a6e8c71add839c0872dd5f1a0bb\" title=\"Try Spacy\" width=\"0\">\n            </iframe>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"6cd4\">\n          If you run that, you\u2019ll get a list of named entities and entity types detected in our document:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"hb hc hd he hf kt ku kv\"><span class=\"ji ip ap ce kw b ez kx ky r kz\" id=\"777a\">London (GPE)<br/>England (GPE)<br/>the United Kingdom (GPE)<br/>the River Thames (FAC)<br/>Great Britain (GPE)<br/>London (GPE)<br/>two millennia (DATE)<br/>Romans (NORP)<br/>Londinium (PERSON)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"9af2\">\n          You can look up what each of those\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://spacy.io/usage/linguistic-features#entity-types\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           entity codes means here\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"cbb8\">\n          Notice that it makes a mistake on \u201cLondinium\u201d and thinks it is the name of a person instead of a place. This is probably because there was nothing in the training data set similar to that and it made a best guess. Named Entity Detection often requires\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://spacy.io/usage/training#section-ner\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           a little bit of model fine tuning\n          </a>\n          if you are parsing text that has unique or specialized terms like this.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"d9b3\">\n          Let\u2019s take the idea of detecting entities and twist it around to build a data scrubber. Let\u2019s say you are trying to comply with the new\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"/@ageitgey/understand-the-gdpr-in-10-minutes-407f4b54111f\" rel=\"noopener\" target=\"_blank\">\n           GDPR privacy regulations\n          </a>\n          and you\u2019ve discovered that you have thousands of documents with personally identifiable information in them like people\u2019s names. You\u2019ve been given the task of removing any and all names from your documents.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"ad07\">\n          Going through thousands of documents and trying to redact all the names by hand could take years. But with NLP, it\u2019s a breeze. Here\u2019s a simple scrubber that removes all the names it detects:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg\">\n          <div class=\"hq r hj\">\n           <div class=\"ks r\">\n            <iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"s t u hn ai\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" src=\"https://medium.com/media/e9696a36f4133b548bb55826b8777c73\" title=\"pii_scrubber.py\" width=\"0\">\n            </iframe>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"210b\">\n          And if you run that, you\u2019ll see that it works as expected:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"hb hc hd he hf kt ku kv\"><span class=\"ji ip ap ce kw b ez kx ky r kz\" id=\"fafa\">In 1950, [REDACTED] published his famous article \"Computing Machinery and Intelligence\". In 1957, [REDACTED] <br/>Syntactic Structures revolutionized Linguistics with 'universal grammar', a rule based system of syntactic structures.</span></pre>\n         <h1 class=\"io ip ap ce cd iq dg ir di is it iu iv iw ix iy iz\" id=\"c36f\">\n          Extracting Facts\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"1857\">\n          What you can do with spaCy right out of the box is pretty amazing. But you can also use the parsed output from spaCy as the input to more complex data extraction algorithms. There\u2019s a python library called\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"http://textacy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           textacy\n          </a>\n          that implements several common data extraction algorithms on top of spaCy. It\u2019s a great starting point.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"4764\">\n          One of the algorithms it implements is called\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://textacy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/api_reference.html#textacy.extract.semistructured_statements\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Semi-structured Statement Extraction\n          </a>\n          . We can use it to search the parse tree for simple statements where the subject is \u201cLondon\u201d and the verb is a form of \u201cbe\u201d. That should help us find facts about London.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"5b52\">\n          Here\u2019s how that looks in code:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg\">\n          <div class=\"hq r hj\">\n           <div class=\"ks r\">\n            <iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"s t u hn ai\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" src=\"https://medium.com/media/d37f2bf04f51f735d3d5d1fa03d43c8a\" title=\"fact_extraction.py\" width=\"0\">\n            </iframe>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"fabf\">\n          And here\u2019s what it prints:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"hb hc hd he hf kt ku kv\"><span class=\"ji ip ap ce kw b ez kx ky r kz\" id=\"17df\">Here are the things I know about London:</span><span class=\"ji ip ap ce kw b ez la lb lc ld le ky r kz\" id=\"9cb3\"> - the capital and most populous city of England and the United Kingdom.<br/>- a major settlement for two millennia.</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"569d\">\n          Maybe that\u2019s not too impressive. But if you run that same code on the entire London wikipedia article text instead of just three sentences, you\u2019ll get this more impressive result:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"hb hc hd he hf kt ku kv\"><span class=\"ji ip ap ce kw b ez kx ky r kz\" id=\"c765\">Here are the things I know about London:</span><span class=\"ji ip ap ce kw b ez la lb lc ld le ky r kz\" id=\"a372\"> - the capital and most populous city of England and the United Kingdom<br/> - a major settlement for two millennia<br/> - the world's most populous city from around 1831 to 1925<br/> - beyond all comparison the largest town in England<br/> - still very compact<br/> - the world's largest city from about 1831 to 1925<br/> - the seat of the Government of the United Kingdom<br/> - vulnerable to flooding<br/> - \"one of the World's Greenest Cities\" with more than 40 percent green space or open water<br/> - the most populous city and metropolitan area of the European Union and the second most populous in Europe<br/> - the 19th largest city and the 18th largest metropolitan region in the world<br/> - Christian, and has a large number of churches, particularly in the City of London<br/> - also home to sizeable Muslim, Hindu, Sikh, and Jewish communities<br/> - also home to 42 Hindu temples<br/> - the world's most expensive office market for the last three years according to world property journal (2015) report<br/> - one of the pre-eminent financial centres of the world as the most important location for international finance<br/> - the world top city destination as ranked by TripAdvisor users<br/> - a major international air transport hub with the busiest city airspace in the world<br/> - the centre of the National Rail network, with 70 percent of rail journeys starting or ending in London<br/> - a major global centre of higher education teaching and research and has the largest concentration of higher education institutes in Europe<br/> - home to designers Vivienne Westwood, Galliano, Stella McCartney, Manolo Blahnik, and Jimmy Choo, among others<br/> - the setting for many works of literature<br/> - a major centre for television production, with studios including BBC Television Centre, The Fountain Studios and The London Studios<br/> - also a centre for urban music<br/> - the \"greenest city\" in Europe with 35,000 acres of public parks, woodlands and gardens<br/> - not the capital of England, as England does not have its own government</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"edff\">\n          Now things are getting interesting! That\u2019s a pretty impressive amount of information we\u2019ve collected automatically.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"d02f\">\n          For extra credit, try installing the\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://github.com/huggingface/neuralcoref\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           neuralcoref\n          </a>\n          library and adding Coreference Resolution to your pipeline. That will get you a few more facts since it will catch sentences that talk about \u201cit\u201d instead of mentioning \u201cLondon\u201d directly.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"ji ip ap ce cd iq jj jk jl jm jn jo jp jq jr js jt\" id=\"881a\">\n          What else can we do?\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"ff28\">\n          By looking through the\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://spacy.io/api/doc\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           spaCy docs\n          </a>\n          and\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"http://textacy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           textacy docs\n          </a>\n          , you\u2019ll see lots of examples of the ways you can work with parsed text. What we\u2019ve seen so far is just a tiny sample.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"c7f7\">\n          Here\u2019s another practical example: Imagine that you were building a website that let\u2019s the user view information for every city in the world using the information we extracted in the last example.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"f3b9\">\n          If you had a search feature on the website, it might be nice to autocomplete common search queries like Google does:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"hg\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"id ie if ig ih ii ae ij af ik ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg il im paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"hh hi hj hk ai\">\n            <div class=\"co cp lf\">\n             <div class=\"hq r hj hr\">\n              <div class=\"lg r\">\n               <div class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai av ho hp\">\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai ht hu hv\" height=\"682\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png?q=20\" width=\"2136\"/>\n               </div>\n               <img class=\"hl hm s t u hn ai hw\" height=\"682\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 1000w\" width=\"2136\"/>\n               <noscript>\n                <img class=\"s t u hn ai\" height=\"682\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/4272/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*CvaGqQ63aSKpZ57Gy0k4Nw.png 1000w\" width=\"2136\"/>\n               </noscript>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n           <figcaption class=\"ci ez hx hy hz cq co cp ia ib cd dx\">\n            Google\u2019s autocomplete suggestions for \u201cLondon\u201d\n           </figcaption>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dc ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"631e\">\n          But to do this, we need a list of possible completions to suggest to the user. We can use NLP to quickly generate this data.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"3de5\">\n          Here\u2019s one way to extract frequently-mentioned noun chunks from a document:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg\">\n          <div class=\"hq r hj\">\n           <div class=\"ks r\">\n            <iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"s t u hn ai\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" src=\"https://medium.com/media/20ddfd82f7f16ea5b11afca292b19c1f\" title=\"key_terms.py\" width=\"0\">\n            </iframe>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"2e63\">\n          If you run that on the London Wikipedia article, you\u2019ll get output like this:\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"hb hc hd he hf kt ku kv\"><span class=\"ji ip ap ce kw b ez kx ky r kz\" id=\"ca3b\">westminster abbey<br/>natural history museum<br/>west end<br/>east end<br/>st paul's cathedral<br/>royal albert hall<br/>london underground<br/>great fire<br/>british museum<br/>london eye</span><span class=\"ji ip ap ce kw b ez la lb lc ld le ky r kz\" id=\"946f\">.... etc ....</span></pre>\n         <h1 class=\"io ip ap ce cd iq dg ir di is it iu iv iw ix iy iz\" id=\"5313\">\n          Going Deeper\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy ja ea jb gn jc gp jd gr je gt cx\" id=\"7d20\">\n          This is just a tiny taste of what you can do with NLP. In future posts, we\u2019ll talk about other applications of NLP like Text Classification and how systems like Amazon Alexa parse questions.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"ab49\">\n          But until then, install\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://spacy.io/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           spaCy\n          </a>\n          and start playing around! Or if you aren\u2019t a Python user and end up using a different NLP library, the ideas should all work roughly the same way.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"3016\">\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           This article is part of an on-going series on NLP. You can continue on to\n          </em>\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"/@ageitgey/text-classification-is-your-new-secret-weapon-7ca4fad15788\" rel=\"noopener\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <em class=\"gu\">\n            Part 2\n           </em>\n          </a>\n          <em class=\"gu\">\n           .\n          </em>\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </section>\n      <hr class=\"lh dx li lj lk hz ll lm ln lo lp\"/>\n      <section class=\"cx cy cz da db\">\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dc ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gi gj ap ce gk b dy gl ea gm gn go gp gq gr gs gt cx\" id=\"ca85\">\n          If you liked this article, consider signing up for my\n          <a class=\"bx fw gv gw gx gy\" href=\"https://www.machinelearningisfun.com/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Machine Learning is Fun!\n          </a>\n          newsletter:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"hb hc hd he hf hg\">\n          <div class=\"hq r hj\">\n           <div class=\"lq r\">\n            <iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"s t u hn ai\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"480\" scrolling=\"auto\" src=\"https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fupscri.be%2F947d84%3Fas_embed%3Dtrue&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fupscri.be%2F947d84%2F&amp;image=https%3A%2F%2Fupscri.be%2Fmedia%2Fform.jpg&amp;key=d04bfffea46d4aeda930ec88cc64b87c&amp;type=text%2Fhtml&amp;schema=upscri\" title=\"Sign up for the Machine Learning is Fun!
