1.8v.4h9.2v-.4l-1.83-1.8c-.18-.18-.2-.24-.2-.53V15.94c0-.3.02-.35.2-.53l1.82-1.8v-.4h-6.47l-4.62 11.55-5.2-11.54h-6.8v.4l2.15 2.63c.24.3.29.37.29.77v10.35z\">\n             </path>\n            </svg>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"r an w\">\n           <div class=\"n o\">\n            <div class=\"n g\">\n             <div class=\"ao\" id=\"lo-post-page-navbar-sign-in-link\">\n              <div class=\"ap r\">\n               <span class=\"aq b ar as at au r av aw\">\n                <a class=\"ax ay az ba bb bc bd be bf bg bh bi bj bk bl bm\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=login&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fbert-explained-state-of-the-art-language-model-for-nlp-f8b21a9b6270&amp;source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                 Sign in\n                </a>\n               </span>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class=\"bn r bo bp\">\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af ag ah ai\">\n         <div class=\"bq br n o\">\n          <div class=\"bs r an\">\n           <a href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n            <div class=\"bt bu r\">\n             <img alt=\"Towards Data Science\" class=\"\" height=\"36\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/200/1*mG6i4Bh_LgixUYXJgQpYsg@2x.png\" width=\"100\"/>\n            </div>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"bv r bw\">\n           <ul class=\"bx bf by bz ca n cb g cc cd ce\">\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/data-science/home?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Data Science\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/machine-learning/home?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Machine Learning\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/programming/home?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Programming\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/data-visualization/home?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Visualization\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/artificial-intelligence/home?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               AI\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/video/home?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Video\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/about-us/home?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               About\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <span class=\"cf cj ck\">\n            </span>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/contribute/home?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Contribute\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n           </ul>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n     </div>\n    </nav>\n    <div class=\"cw cx r cy cz\">\n    </div>\n    <article>\n     <section class=\"da db dc dd ai de df n dg\">\n     </section>\n     <span class=\"r\">\n     </span>\n     <div>\n      <div class=\"s u dh di dj dk\">\n      </div>\n      <section class=\"dl dm dn do dp\">\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dq ah ai\">\n         <div>\n          <div class=\"dr ds dt ar du b dv dw dx dy dz ea eb ec ed ee ef\" id=\"7d26\">\n           <h1 class=\"du b dv eg dx eh dz ei eb ej ed ek dt\">\n            <a class=\"cq el em en eo ep\" href=\"https://www.lyrn.ai/2018/11/07/explained-bert-state-of-the-art-language-model-for-nlp/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n             BERT Explained\n            </a>\n            : State of the art language model for NLP\n           </h1>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"eq\">\n           <div class=\"n er es et eu\">\n            <div class=\"o n\">\n             <div>\n              <a href=\"/@ranihorev?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               <img alt=\"Rani Horev\" class=\"r ev ew ex\" height=\"48\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/fit/c/96/96/1*Ia2Wg4LE1Wo26SJc83GIig.jpeg\" width=\"48\"/>\n              </a>\n             </div>\n             <div class=\"ey ai r\">\n              <div class=\"n\">\n               <div style=\"flex:1\">\n                <span class=\"aq b ar as at au r dt q\">\n                 <div class=\"ez n o fa\">\n                  <span class=\"aq cl fb as br fc fd fe ff fg dt\">\n                   <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg fh bj bk fi fj\" href=\"/@ranihorev?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                    Rani Horev\n                   </a>\n                  </span>\n                  <div class=\"fk r an h\">\n                   <a class=\"fl dt q fm fn fo fp fq bg fi fr fs ft fu fv fw fx aq b ar fy cm au fz ga df gb el bj\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=register&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fbert-explained-state-of-the-art-language-model-for-nlp-f8b21a9b6270&amp;source=-53f9e9fdd8d8-------------------------follow_byline-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                    Follow\n                   </a>\n                  </div>\n                 </div>\n                </span>\n               </div>\n              </div>\n              <span class=\"aq b ar as at au r av aw\">\n               <span class=\"aq cl fb as br fc fd fe ff fg av\">\n                <div>\n                 <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg fh bj bk fi fj\" href=\"/bert-explained-state-of-the-art-language-model-for-nlp-f8b21a9b6270?source=post_page-----f8b21a9b6270----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                  Nov 10, 2018\n                 </a>\n                 <!-- -->\n                 \u00b7\n                 <!-- -->\n                 <!-- -->\n                 7\n                 <!-- -->\n                 min read\n                </div>\n               </span>\n              </span>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n            <div class=\"n gc gd ge gf gg gh gi gj y\">\n             <div class=\"n o\">\n              <div class=\"gk r an\">\n               <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gl gm bj bk fi fj\" href=\"//medium.com/p/f8b21a9b6270/share/twitter?source=post_actions_header---------------------------\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n                <svg class=\"q\" height=\"29\" width=\"29\">\n                 <path d=\"M22.05 7.54a4.47 4.47 0 0 0-3.3-1.46 4.53 4.53 0 0 0-4.53 4.53c0 .35.04.7.08 1.05A12.9 12.9 0 0 1 5 6.89a5.1 5.1 0 0 0-.65 2.26c.03 1.6.83 2.99 2.02 3.79a4.3 4.3 0 0 1-2.02-.57v.08a4.55 4.55 0 0 0 3.63 4.44c-.4.08-.8.13-1.21.16l-.81-.08a4.54 4.54 0 0 0 4.2 3.15 9.56 9.56 0 0 1-5.66 1.94l-1.05-.08c2 1.27 4.38 2.02 6.94 2.02 8.3 0 12.86-6.9 12.84-12.85.02-.24 0-.43 0-.65a8.68 8.68 0 0 0 2.26-2.34c-.82.38-1.7.62-2.6.72a4.37 4.37 0 0 0 1.95-2.51c-.84.53-1.81.9-2.83 1.13z\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gk r an\">\n               <button class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gl gm bj bk fi fj\">\n                <svg class=\"q\" fill=\"none\" height=\"29\" viewbox=\"0 0 29 29\" width=\"29\">\n                 <path d=\"M5 6.36C5 5.61 5.63 5 6.4 5h16.2c.77 0 1.4.61 1.4 1.36v16.28c0 .75-.63 1.36-1.4 1.36H6.4c-.77 0-1.4-.6-1.4-1.36V6.36z\">\n                 </path>\n                 <path clip-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M10.76 20.9v-8.57H7.89v8.58h2.87zm-1.44-9.75c1 0 1.63-.65 1.63-1.48-.02-.84-.62-1.48-1.6-1.48-.99 0-1.63.64-1.63 1.48 0 .83.62 1.48 1.59 1.48h.01zM12.35 20.9h2.87v-4.79c0-.25.02-.5.1-.7.2-.5.67-1.04 1.46-1.04 1.04 0 1.46.8 1.46 1.95v4.59h2.87v-4.92c0-2.64-1.42-3.87-3.3-3.87-1.55 0-2.23.86-2.61 1.45h.02v-1.24h-2.87c.04.8 0 8.58 0 8.58z\" fill=\"#fff\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </button>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gk r an\">\n               <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gl gm bj bk fi fj\" href=\"//medium.com/p/f8b21a9b6270/share/facebook?source=post_actions_header---------------------------\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n                <svg class=\"q\" height=\"29\" width=\"29\">\n                 <path d=\"M23.2 5H5.8a.8.8 0 0 0-.8.8V23.2c0 .44.35.8.8.8h9.3v-7.13h-2.38V13.9h2.38v-2.38c0-2.45 1.55-3.66 3.74-3.66 1.05 0 1.95.08 2.2.11v2.57h-1.5c-1.2 0-1.48.57-1.48 1.4v1.96h2.97l-.6 2.97h-2.37l.05 7.12h5.1a.8.8 0 0 0 .79-.8V5.8a.8.8 0 0 0-.8-.79\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gn r\">\n               <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gl gm bj bk fi fj\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=register&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fbert-explained-state-of-the-art-language-model-for-nlp-f8b21a9b6270&amp;source=post_actions_header--------------------------bookmark_header-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                <svg height=\"25\" viewbox=\"0 0 25 25\" width=\"25\">\n                 <path d=\"M19 6a2 2 0 0 0-2-2H8a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v14.66h.01c.01.1.05.2.12.28a.5.5 0 0 0 .7.03l5.67-4.12 5.66 4.13a.5.5 0 0 0 .71-.03.5.5 0 0 0 .12-.29H19V6zm-6.84 9.97L7 19.64V6a1 1 0 0 1 1-1h9a1 1 0 0 1 1 1v13.64l-5.16-3.67a.49.49 0 0 0-.68 0z\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"go r am\">\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"4d61\">\n          BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) is a recent\n          <a class=\"cq el em en eo ep\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/pdf/1810.04805.pdf\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           paper\n          </a>\n          published by researchers at Google AI Language. It has caused a stir in the Machine Learning community by presenting state-of-the-art results in a wide variety of NLP tasks, including Question Answering (SQuAD v1.1), Natural Language Inference (MNLI), and others.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"0228\">\n          BERT\u2019s key technical innovation is applying the bidirectional training of Transformer, a popular attention model, to language modelling. This is in contrast to previous efforts which looked at a text sequence either from left to right or combined left-to-right and right-to-left training. The paper\u2019s results show that a language model which is bidirectionally trained can have a deeper sense of language context and flow than single-direction language models. In the paper, the researchers detail a novel technique named Masked LM (MLM) which allows bidirectional training in models in which it was previously impossible.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"hd he dt ar aq hf dv hg dx hh hi hj hk hl hm hn ho\" id=\"4228\">\n          Background\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs hp gu hq gw hr gy hs ha ht hc dl\" id=\"f581\">\n          In the field of computer vision, researchers have repeatedly shown the value of transfer learning \u2014 pre-training a neural network model on a known task, for instance ImageNet, and then performing fine-tuning \u2014 using the trained neural network as the basis of a new purpose-specific model. In recent years, researchers have been showing that a similar technique can be useful in many natural language tasks.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"7e38\">\n          A different approach, which is also popular in NLP tasks and exemplified in the recent ELMo paper, is feature-based training. In this approach, a pre-trained neural network produces word embeddings which are then used as features in NLP models.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"hd he dt ar aq hf dv hg dx hh hi hj hk hl hm hn ho\" id=\"d608\">\n          How BERT works\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs hp gu hq gw hr gy hs ha ht hc dl\" id=\"aa44\">\n          BERT makes use of Transformer, an attention mechanism that learns contextual relations between words (or sub-words) in a text. In its vanilla form, Transformer includes two separate mechanisms \u2014 an encoder that reads the text input and a decoder that produces a prediction for the task. Since BERT\u2019s goal is to generate a language model, only the encoder mechanism is necessary. The detailed workings of Transformer are described in a\n          <a class=\"cq el em en eo ep\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.03762.pdf\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           paper\n          </a>\n          by Google.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"5c18\">\n          As opposed to directional models, which read the text input sequentially (left-to-right or right-to-left), the Transformer encoder reads the entire sequence of words at once. Therefore it is considered bidirectional, though it would be more accurate to say that it\u2019s non-directional. This characteristic allows the model to learn the context of a word based on all of its surroundings (left and right of the word).\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"44ec\">\n          The chart below is a high-level description of the Transformer encoder. The input is a sequence of tokens, which are first embedded into vectors and then processed in the neural network. The output is a sequence of vectors of size H, in which each vector corresponds to an input token with the same index.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"2bb9\">\n          When training language models, there is a challenge of defining a prediction goal. Many models predict the next word in a sequence (e.g. \u201cThe child came home from ___\u201d), a directional approach which inherently limits context learning. To overcome this challenge, BERT uses two training strategies:\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"hu he dt ar aq hf hv hw hx hy hz ia ib ic id ie if\" id=\"20d5\">\n          Masked LM (MLM)\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs hp gu hq gw hr gy hs ha ht hc dl\" id=\"4af4\">\n          Before feeding word sequences into BERT, 15% of the words in each sequence are replaced with a [MASK] token. The model then attempts to predict the original value of the masked words, based on the context provided by the other, non-masked, words in the sequence. In technical terms, the prediction of the output words requires:\n         </p>\n         <ol class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc ig ih ii\" id=\"d8d9\">\n           Adding a classification layer on top of the encoder output.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"c4f7\">\n           Multiplying the output vectors by the embedding matrix, transforming them into the vocabulary dimension.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"6fad\">\n           Calculating the probability of each word in the vocabulary with softmax.\n          </li>\n         </ol>\n         <figure class=\"ip iq ir is it iu dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"iv iw ix iy ai\">\n           <div class=\"dc dd io\">\n            <div class=\"je r ix jf\">\n             <div class=\"jg r\">\n              <div class=\"iz ja s t u jb ai br jc jd\">\n               <img class=\"s t u jb ai jh ji jj\" height=\"594\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png?q=20\" width=\"876\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"iz ja s t u jb ai jk\" height=\"594\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png 700w\" width=\"876\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u jb ai\" height=\"594\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1752/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png 700w\" width=\"876\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"80e5\">\n          The BERT loss function takes into consideration only the prediction of the masked values and ignores the prediction of the non-masked words. As a consequence, the model converges slower than directional models, a characteristic which is offset by its increased context awareness (see Takeaways #3).\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"eecb\">\n          <em class=\"jl\">\n           Note: In practice, the BERT implementation is slightly more elaborate and doesn\u2019t replace all of the 15% masked words. See\n          </em>\n          <a class=\"cq el em en eo ep\" href=\"https://www.lyrn.ai/2018/11/07/explained-bert-state-of-the-art-language-model-for-nlp/#appendix-A\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <em class=\"jl\">\n            Appendix A\n           </em>\n          </a>\n          <em class=\"jl\">\n           for additional information.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"hu he dt ar aq hf hv hw hx hy hz ia ib ic id ie if\" id=\"817d\">\n          Next Sentence Prediction (NSP)\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs hp gu hq gw hr gy hs ha ht hc dl\" id=\"b459\">\n          In the BERT training process, the model receives pairs of sentences as input and learns to predict if the second sentence in the pair is the subsequent sentence in the original document. During training, 50% of the inputs are a pair in which the second sentence is the subsequent sentence in the original document, while in the other 50% a random sentence from the corpus is chosen as the second sentence. The assumption is that the random sentence will be disconnected from the first sentence.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"7d53\">\n          To help the model distinguish between the two sentences in training, the input is processed in the following way before entering the model:\n         </p>\n         <ol class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc ig ih ii\" id=\"2c16\">\n           A [CLS] token is inserted at the beginning of the first sentence and a [SEP] token is inserted at the end of each sentence.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"5a07\">\n           A sentence embedding indicating Sentence A or Sentence B is added to each token. Sentence embeddings are similar in concept to token embeddings with a vocabulary of 2.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"9328\">\n           A positional embedding is added to each token to indicate its position in the sequence. The concept and implementation of positional embedding are presented in the Transformer paper.\n          </li>\n         </ol>\n         <figure class=\"ip iq ir is it iu dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"iv iw ix iy ai\">\n           <div class=\"dc dd jm\">\n            <div class=\"je r ix jf\">\n             <div class=\"jn r\">\n              <div class=\"iz ja s t u jb ai br jc jd\">\n               <img class=\"s t u jb ai jh ji jj\" height=\"369\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png?q=20\" width=\"1174\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"iz ja s t u jb ai jk\" height=\"369\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png 700w\" width=\"1174\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u jb ai\" height=\"369\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2348/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png 700w\" width=\"1174\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av fb jo jp jq de dc dd jr js aq cl\">\n           Source:\n           <a class=\"cq el em en eo ep\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/abs/1810.04805\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            BERT\n           </a>\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            [Devlin et al\n           </em>\n           ., 2018], with modifications\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"f86b\">\n          To predict if the second sentence is indeed connected to the first, the following steps are performed:\n         </p>\n         <ol class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc ig ih ii\" id=\"cc43\">\n           The entire input sequence goes through the Transformer model.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"9985\">\n           The output of the [CLS] token is transformed into a 2\u00d71 shaped vector, using a simple classification layer (learned matrices of weights and biases).\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"6de1\">\n           Calculating the probability of IsNextSequence with softmax.\n          </li>\n         </ol>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"f1e2\">\n          When training the BERT model, Masked LM and Next Sentence Prediction are trained together, with the goal of minimizing the combined loss function of the two strategies.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"hd he dt ar aq hf dv hg dx hh hi hj hk hl hm hn ho\" id=\"77c5\">\n          How to use BERT (Fine-tuning)\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs hp gu hq gw hr gy hs ha ht hc dl\" id=\"5805\">\n          Using BERT for a specific task is relatively straightforward:\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"b60f\">\n          BERT can be used for a wide variety of language tasks, while only adding a small layer to the core model:\n         </p>\n         <ol class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc ig ih ii\" id=\"d438\">\n           Classification tasks such as sentiment analysis are done similarly to Next Sentence classification, by adding a classification layer on top of the Transformer output for the [CLS] token.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"74b2\">\n           In Question Answering tasks (e.g. SQuAD v1.1), the software receives a question regarding a text sequence and is required to mark the answer in the sequence. Using BERT, a Q&amp;A model can be trained by learning two extra vectors that mark the beginning and the end of the answer.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"7da9\">\n           In Named Entity Recognition (NER), the software receives a text sequence and is required to mark the various types of entities (Person, Organization, Date, etc) that appear in the text. Using BERT, a NER model can be trained by feeding the output vector of each token into a classification layer that predicts the NER label.\n          </li>\n         </ol>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"6135\">\n          In the fine-tuning training, most hyper-parameters stay the same as in BERT training, and the paper gives specific guidance (Section 3.5) on the hyper-parameters that require tuning. The BERT team has used this technique to achieve state-of-the-art results on a wide variety of challenging natural language tasks, detailed in Section 4 of the paper.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"hd he dt ar aq hf dv hg dx hh hi hj hk hl hm hn ho\" id=\"e15e\">\n          Takeaways\n         </h1>\n         <ol class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs hp gu hq gw hr gy hs ha ht hc ig ih ii\" id=\"dcc1\">\n           <em class=\"jl\">\n            Model size matters, even at huge scale.\n           </em>\n           BERT_large, with 345 million parameters, is the largest model of its kind. It is demonstrably superior on small-scale tasks to BERT_base, which uses the same architecture with \u201conly\u201d 110 million parameters.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"37b5\">\n           <em class=\"jl\">\n            With enough training data, more training steps == higher accuracy.\n           </em>\n           For instance, on the MNLI task, the BERT_base accuracy improves by 1.0% when trained on 1M steps (128,000 words batch size) compared to 500K steps with the same batch size.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc ig ih ii\" id=\"b9fc\">\n           <em class=\"jl\">\n            BERT\u2019s bidirectional approach (MLM) converges slower than left-to-right approaches\n           </em>\n           (because only 15% of words are predicted in each batch) but bidirectional training still outperforms left-to-right training after a small number of pre-training steps.\n          </li>\n         </ol>\n         <figure class=\"ip iq ir is it iu dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"iv iw ix iy ai\">\n           <div class=\"dc dd ju\">\n            <div class=\"je r ix jf\">\n             <div class=\"jv r\">\n              <div class=\"iz ja s t u jb ai br jc jd\">\n               <img class=\"s t u jb ai jh ji jj\" height=\"1042\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png?q=20\" width=\"1576\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"iz ja s t u jb ai jk\" height=\"1042\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png 700w\" width=\"1576\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u jb ai\" height=\"1042\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/3152/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*KONsqvDohE7ytu_E.png 700w\" width=\"1576\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av fb jo jp jq de dc dd jr js aq cl\">\n           Source:\n           <a class=\"cq el em en eo ep\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/abs/1810.04805\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            BERT\n           </a>\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            [Devlin et al\n           </em>\n           ., 2018]\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <h1 class=\"hd he dt ar aq hf dv hg dx hh hi hj hk hl hm hn ho\" id=\"7fb4\">\n          Compute considerations (training and applying)\n         </h1>\n         <figure class=\"ip iq ir is it iu dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"iv iw ix iy ai\">\n           <div class=\"dc dd jw\">\n            <div class=\"je r ix jf\">\n             <div class=\"jx r\">\n              <div class=\"iz ja s t u jb ai br jc jd\">\n               <img class=\"s t u jb ai jh ji jj\" height=\"142\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png?q=20\" width=\"778\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"iz ja s t u jb ai jk\" height=\"142\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png 700w\" width=\"778\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u jb ai\" height=\"142\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1556/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1*LgbpLsRUGbtTPmMSUO2Drw.png 700w\" width=\"778\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <h1 class=\"hd he dt ar aq hf dv hg dx hh hi hj hk hl hm hn ho\" id=\"fffe\">\n          Conclusion\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs hp gu hq gw hr gy hs ha ht hc dl\" id=\"ebd6\">\n          BERT is undoubtedly a breakthrough in the use of Machine Learning for Natural Language Processing. The fact that it\u2019s approachable and allows fast fine-tuning will likely allow a wide range of practical applications in the future. In this summary, we attempted to describe the main ideas of the paper while not drowning in excessive technical details. For those wishing for a deeper dive, we highly recommend reading the full article and ancillary articles referenced in it. Another useful reference is the\n          <a class=\"cq el em en eo ep\" href=\"https://github.com/google-research/bert\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           BERT source code\n          </a>\n          and models, which cover 103 languages and were generously released as open source by the research team.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"hu he dt ar aq hf hv hw hx hy hz ia ib ic id ie if\" id=\"b343\">\n          Appendix A \u2014 Word Masking\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs hp gu hq gw hr gy hs ha ht hc dl\" id=\"9033\">\n          Training the language model in BERT is done by predicting 15% of the tokens in the input, that were randomly picked. These tokens are pre-processed as follows \u2014 80% are replaced with a \u201c[MASK]\u201d token, 10% with a random word, and 10% use the original word. The intuition that led the authors to pick this approach is as follows (Thanks to Jacob Devlin from Google for the insight):\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc jy ih ii\" id=\"fad7\">\n           If we used [MASK] 100% of the time the model wouldn\u2019t necessarily produce good token representations for non-masked words. The non-masked tokens were still used for context, but the model was optimized for predicting masked words.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc jy ih ii\" id=\"b8ed\">\n           If we used [MASK] 90% of the time and random words 10% of the time, this would teach the model that the observed word is\n           <em class=\"jl\">\n            never\n           </em>\n           correct.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs ij gu ik gw il gy im ha in hc jy ih ii\" id=\"3d22\">\n           If we used [MASK] 90% of the time and kept the same word 10% of the time, then the model could just trivially copy the non-contextual embedding.\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"4702\">\n          No ablation was done on the ratios of this approach, and it may have worked better with different ratios. In addition, the model performance wasn\u2019t tested with simply masking 100% of the selected tokens.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dt ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dl\" id=\"48b6\">\n          <em class=\"jl\">\n           For more summaries on the recent Machine Learning research, check out\n          </em>\n          <a class=\"cq el em en eo ep\" href=\"https://www.lyrn.ai\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <em class=\"jl\">\n            Lyrn.AI\n           </em>\n          </a>\n          <em class=\"jl\">\n           .\n          </em>\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </section>\n     </div>\n    </article>\n    <div class=\"iz dk jz ka ai kh kf ki\" data-test-id=\"post-sidebar\">\n     <div class=\"n p\">\n      <div class=\"z ab ac ae af ag ah ai\">\n       <div class=\"kj n dg\">\n        <div class=\"dk\">\n         <div class=\"kk kl r\">\n          <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gl gm bj bk fi fj\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/?source=post_sidebar--------------------------post_sidebar-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n           <h2 class=\"aq hf km as dt\">\n            Towards Data Science\n           </h2>\n          </a>\n          <div class=\"kn ko r\">\n           <h4 class=\"aq cl fb as br kp fd fe kq fg av\">\n            A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas, and codes.\n           </h4>\n          </div>\n          <div aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"gb\">\n           <a class=\"kr fm ax ay ks bh bi kt bg fx aq b ar as at au fz ga df gb el       <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gl gm bj bk fi fj\" 0 0-2.67-.01 1.87 1.87 0 0 0-.5.9c-.76-.75-2-.75-2.7-.04a1.88 1.88 0 0 0 0 2.66c-.3.12-.61.29-.87.55a1.88 1.88 0 0 0 0 2.66l.62.62a1.88 1.88 0 0 0-.9 3.16l5.01 5.02c1.6 1.6 3.52 2.64 5.4 2.96a7.16        </a>\n           </div>\n           <div class=\"lg r\">\n            <div class=\"lh\">\n             <h4 class=\"aq cl fb as av\">\n              <button class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n     </div>\n    </div>\n    <div class=\"iz dk jz ka kb kc kd ke kf kg\">\n    </div>\n    <div>\n     <div class=\"li iu n dg p\">\n      <div class=\"n p\">\n       <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dq ah ai\">\n        <div class=\"n lj\">\n        </div>\n        <div class=\"n o lj\">\n        </div>\n        <div class=\"lk r\">\n         <ul class=\"be bf\">\n          <li class=\"gb bx gn ll\">\n           <a class=\"lm ln el av r lo lp a b cm\" href=\"/tag/machine-learning\">\n            Machine Learning\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gb bx gn ll\">\n           <a class=\"lm ln el av r lo lp a b cm\" href=\"/tag/nlp\">\n            NLP\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gb bx gn ll\">\n           <a class=\"lm ln el av r lo lp a b cm\" href=\"/tag/bert\">\n            Bert\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gb bx gn ll\">\n           <a class=\"lm ln el av r lo lp a b cm\" href=\"/tag/deep-learning\">\n            Deep Learning\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </div>\n        <div class=\"lq n er y\">\n         <div class=\"n o\">\n          <div class=\"lr r ix\">\n           <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gl gm bj bk fi fj\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=register&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fbert-explained-state-of-the-art-language-model-for-nlp-f8b21a9b6270&amp;source=post_actions_footer-----f8b21a9b6270---------------------clap_footer-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n            <div class=\"c ls ev n o lt ix lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg kt\">\n             <div class=\"be ky kz la lb lc mh le o jk ev n p mi u jb s t ai ay lf bi mj\">\n              <svg height=\"33\" viewbox=\"0 0 33 33\" width=\"33\">\n               <path d=\"M28.86 17.34l-3.64-6.4c-.3-.43-.71-.73-1.16-.8a1.12 1.12 0 0 0-.9.21c-.62.5-.73 1.18-.32 2.06l1.22 2.6 1.4 2.45c2.23 4.09 1.51 8-2.15 11.66a9.6 9.6 0 0 1-.8.71 6.53 6.53 0 0 0 4.3-2.1c3.82-3.82 3.57-7.87 2.05-10.39zm-6.25 11.08c3.35-3.35 4-6.78 1.98-10.47L21.2 12c-.3-.43-.71-.72-1.16-.8a1.12 1.12 0 0 0-.9.22c-.62.49-.74 1.18-.32 2.06l1.72 3.63a.5.5 0 0 1-.81.57l-8.91-8.9a1.33 1.33 0 0 0-1.89 1.88l5.3 5.3a.5.5 0 0 1-.71.7l-5.3-5.3-1.49-1.49c-.5-.5-1.38-.5-1.88 0a1.34 1.34 0 0 0 0 1.89l1.49 1.5 5.3 5.28a.5.5 0 0 1-.36.86.5.5 0 0 1-.36-.15l-5.29-5.29a1.34 1.34 0 0 0-1.88 0 1.34 1.34 0 0 0 0 1.89l2.23 2.23L9.3 21.4a.5.5 0 0 1-.36.85.5.5 0 0 1-.35-.14l-3.32-3.33a1.33 1.33 0 0 0-1.89 0 1.32 1.32 0 0 0-.39.95c0 .35.14.69.4.94l6.39 6.4c3.53 3.53 8.86 5.3 12.82 1.35zM12.73 9.26l5.68 5.68-.49-1.04c-.52-1.1-.43-2.13.22-2.89l-3.3-3.3a1.34 1.34 0 0 0-1.88 0 1.33 1.33 0 0 0-.4.94c0 .22.07.42.17.61zm14.79 19.18a7.46 7.46 0 0 1-6.41 2.31 7.92 7.92 0 0 1-3.67.9c-3.05 0-6.12-1.63-8.36-3.88l-6.4-6.4A2.31 2.31 0 0 1 2 19.72a2.33 2.33 0 0 1 1.92-2.3l-.87-.87a2.34 2.34 0 0 1 0-3.3 2.33 Explained: State of the art language model for NLP\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[{\"type\":\"id\",\"generated\":true,\"id\":\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_0.markups.0\",\"typename\":\"Markup\"}],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_0.markups.0\":{\"type\":\"A\",\"start\":0,\"end\":14,\"href\":\"https:\\u002F\\u002Fwww.lyrn.ai\\u002F2018\\u002F11\\u002F07\\u002Fexplained-bert-state-of-the-art-language-model-for-nlp\\u002F\",\"anchorType\":\"LINK\",\"userId\":null,\"linkMetadata\":null,\"__typename\":\"Markup\"},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_1\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_1\",\"name\":\"4d61\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) is a recent paper published by researchers at Google AI Language. It has caused a stir in the Machine Learning community by presenting state-of-the-art results in a wide variety of NLP tasks, including Question Answering (SQuAD v1.1), Natural Language Inference (MNLI), and others.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[{\"type\":\"id\",\"generated\":true,\"id\":\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_1.markups.0\",\"typename\":\"Markup\"}],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_1.markups.0\":{\"type\":\"A\",\"start\":75,\"end\":80,\"href\":\"https:\\u002F\\u002Farxiv.org\\u002Fpdf\\u002F1810.04805.pdf\",\"anchorType\":\"LINK\",\"userId\":null,\"linkMetadata\":null,\"__typename\":\"Markup\"},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_2\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_2\",\"name\":\"0228\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"BERT\u2019s key technical innovation is applying the bidirectional training of Transformer, a popular attention model, to language modelling. This is in contrast to previous efforts which looked at a text sequence either from left to right or combined left-to-right and right-to-left training. The paper\u2019s results show that a language model which is bidirectionally trained can have a deeper sense of language context and flow than single-direction language models. In the paper, the researchers detail a novel technique named Masked LM (MLM) which allows bidirectional training in models in which it was previously impossible.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_3\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_3\",\"name\":\"4228\",\"type\":\"H3\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"Background\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_4\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_4\",\"name\":\"f581\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"In the field of computer vision, researchers have repeatedly shown the value of transfer learning \u2014 pre-training a neural network model on a known task, for instance ImageNet, and then performing fine-tuning \u2014 using the trained neural network as the basis of a new purpose-specific model. In recent years, researchers have been showing that a similar technique can be useful in many natural language tasks.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_5\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_5\",\"name\":\"7e38\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"A different approach, which is also popular in NLP tasks and exemplified in the recent ELMo paper, is feature-based training. In this approach, a pre-trained neural network produces word embeddings which are then used as features in NLP models.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_6\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_6\",\"name\":\"d608\",\"type\":\"H3\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"How BERT works\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_7\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_7\",\"name\":\"aa44\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"BERT makes use of Transformer, an attention mechanism that learns contextual relations between words (or sub-words) in a text. In its vanilla form, Transformer includes two separate mechanisms \u2014 an encoder that reads the text input and a decoder that produces a prediction for the task. Since BERT\u2019s goal is to generate a language model, only the encoder mechanism is necessary. The detailed workings of Transformer are described in a paper by Google.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[{\"type\":\"id\",\"generated\":true,\"id\":\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_7.markups.0\",\"typename\":\"Markup\"}],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_7.markups.0\":{\"type\":\"A\",\"start\":435,\"end\":440,\"href\":\"https:\\u002F\\u002Farxiv.org\\u002Fpdf\\u002F1706.03762.pdf\",\"anchorType\":\"LINK\",\"userId\":null,\"linkMetadata\":null,\"__typename\":\"Markup\"},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_8\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_8\",\"name\":\"5c18\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"As opposed to directional models, which read the text input sequentially (left-to-right or right-to-left), the Transformer encoder reads the entire sequence of words at once. Therefore it is considered bidirectional, though it would be more accurate to say that it\u2019s non-directional. This characteristic allows the model to learn the context of a word based on all of its surroundings (left and right of the word).\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_9\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_9\",\"name\":\"44ec\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"The chart below is a high-level description of the Transformer encoder. The input is a sequence of tokens, which are first embedded into vectors and then processed in the neural network. The output is a sequence of vectors of size H, in which each vector corresponds to an input token with the same index.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_10\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_10\",\"name\":\"2bb9\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"When training language models, there is a challenge of defining a prediction goal. Many models predict the next word in a sequence (e.g. \u201cThe child came home from ___\u201d), a directional approach which inherently limits context learning. To overcome this challenge, BERT uses two training strategies:\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_11\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_11\",\"name\":\"20d5\",\"type\":\"H4\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"Masked LM (MLM)\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_12\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_12\",\"name\":\"4af4\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"Before feeding word sequences into BERT, 15% of the words in each sequence are replaced with a [MASK] token. The model then attempts to predict the original value of the masked words, based on the context provided by the other, non-masked, words in the sequence. In technical terms, the prediction of the output words requires:\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_13\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_13\",\"name\":\"d8d9\",\"type\":\"OLI\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"Adding a classification layer on top of the encoder output.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_14\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_14\",\"name\":\"c4f7\",\"type\":\"OLI\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"Multiplying the output vectors by the embedding matrix, transforming them into the vocabulary dimension.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_15\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_15\",\"name\":\"6fad\",\"type\":\"OLI\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"Calculating the probability of each word in the vocabulary with softmax.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_16\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_16\",\"name\":\"8d7d\",\"type\":\"IMG\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":\"INSET_CENTER\",\"metadata\":{\"type\":\"id\",\"generated\":false,\"id\":\"ImageMetadata:0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png\",\"typename\":\"ImageMetadata\"},\"text\":\"\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"ImageMetadata:0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png\":{\"id\":\"0*ViwaI3Vvbnd-CJSQ.png\",\"originalHeight\":594,\"originalWidth\":876,\"focusPercentX\":null,\"focusPercentY\":null,\"alt\":null,\"__typename\":\"ImageMetadata\"},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_17\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_17\",\"name\":\"80e5\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"The BERT loss function takes into consideration only the prediction of the masked values and ignores the prediction of the non-masked words. As a consequence, the model converges slower than directional models, a characteristic which is offset by its increased context awareness (see Takeaways #3).\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_18\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_18\",\"name\":\"eecb\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"Note: In practice, the BERT implementation is slightly more elaborate and doesn\u2019t replace all of the 15% masked words. See Appendix A for additional information.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[{\"type\":\"id\",\"generated\":true,\"id\":\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_18.markups.0\",\"typename\":\"Markup\"},{\"type\":\"id\",\"generated\":true,\"id\":\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_18.markups.1\",\"typename\":\"Markup\"}],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_18.markups.0\":{\"type\":\"A\",\"start\":123,\"end\":133,\"href\":\"https:\\u002F\\u002Fwww.lyrn.ai\\u002F2018\\u002F11\\u002F07\\u002Fexplained-bert-state-of-the-art-language-model-for-nlp\\u002F#appendix-A\",\"anchorType\":\"LINK\",\"userId\":null,\"linkMetadata\":null,\"__typename\":\"Markup\"},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_18.markups.1\":{\"type\":\"EM\",\"start\":0,\"end\":161,\"href\":null,\"anchorType\":null,\"userId\":null,\"linkMetadata\":null,\"__typename\":\"Markup\"},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_19\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_19\",\"name\":\"817d\",\"type\":\"H4\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"Next Sentence Prediction (NSP)\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_20\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_20\",\"name\":\"b459\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"In the BERT training process, the model receives pairs of sentences as input and learns to predict if the second sentence in the pair is the subsequent sentence in the original document. During training, 50% of the inputs are a pair in which the second sentence is the subsequent sentence in the original document, while in the other 50% a random sentence from the corpus is chosen as the second sentence. The assumption is that the random sentence will be disconnected from the first sentence.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_21\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_21\",\"name\":\"7d53\",\"type\":\"P\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"To help the model distinguish between the two sentences in training, the input is processed in the following way before entering the model:\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_22\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_22\",\"name\":\"2c16\",\"type\":\"OLI\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"A [CLS] token is inserted at the beginning of the first sentence and a [SEP] token is inserted at the end of each sentence.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_23\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_23\",\"name\":\"5a07\",\"type\":\"OLI\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"A sentence embedding indicating Sentence A or Sentence B is added to each token. Sentence embeddings are similar in concept to token embeddings with a vocabulary of 2.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_24\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_24\",\"name\":\"9328\",\"type\":\"OLI\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":null,\"metadata\":null,\"text\":\"A positional embedding is added to each token to indicate its position in the sequence. paper.\",\"hasDropCap\":null,\"dropCapImage\":null,\"markups\":[],\"__typename\":\"Paragraph\",\"iframe\":null,\"mixtapeMetadata\":null},\"Paragraph:ba9cea44de23_25\":{\"id\":\"ba9cea44de23_25\",\"name\":\"f286\",\"type\":\"IMG\",\"href\":null,\"layout\":\"INSET_CENTER\",\"metadata\":{\"type\":\"id\",\"generated\":false,\"id\":\"ImageMetadata:0*m_kXt3uqZH9e7H4w.png\",\"typename\":\"ImageMetadata\"},\"text\":\"Source: </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gk r am\">\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"gl\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"gm gn go gp gq gr ae gs af gt ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"hn r\">\n               <div class=\"hg hh s t u hi ai br hj hk\">\n                <img class=\"s t u hi ai ho hp hq\" height=\"969\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2560/1*LeJ3vMxW4ZvcS4ZsDyJDYA.jpeg\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*LeJ3vMxW4ZvcS4ZsDyJDYA.jpeg 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*LeJ3vMxW4ZvcS4ZsDyJDYA.jpeg 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*LeJ3vMxW4ZvcS4ZsDyJDYA.jpeg 1000w\" width=\"1280\"/>\n               </noscript>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n           <figcaption class=\"av ew hs ht hu de dc dd hv hw aq cl\">\n            Photo Credit: Pixabay\n           </figcaption>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dq ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"8704\">\n          <a class=\"cq fx il im in io\" href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Topic_model\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n            Topic modeling\n           </strong>\n          </a>\n          is a type of statistical modeling for discovering the abstract \u201ctopics\u201d that occur in a collection of documents.\n          <a class=\"cq fx il im in io\" href=\"http://blog.echen.me/2011/08/22/introduction-to-latent-dirichlet-allocation/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n            Latent Dirichlet Allocation\n           </strong>\n          </a>\n          (LDA) is an example of topic model and is used to classify text in a document to a particular topic. It builds a topic per document model and words per topic model, modeled as Dirichlet distributions.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"1cb4\">\n          Here we are going to apply LDA to a set of documents and split them into topics. Let\u2019s get started!\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"iq ir dt ar aq is dv it dx iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb\" id=\"4515\">\n          The Data\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jc ic jd ie je ig jf ii jg ik dl\" id=\"7e89\">\n          The data set we\u2019ll use is a list of over one million news headlines published over a period of 15 years and can be downloaded from\n          <a class=\"cq fx il im in io\" href=\"https://www.kaggle.com/therohk/million-headlines/data\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Kaggle\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"791f\">import pandas as pd</span><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jo jp jq jr js jm r jn\" id=\"cdb4\">data = pd.read_csv('abcnews-date-text.csv', error_bad_lines=False);<br/>data_text = data[['headline_text']]<br/>data_text['index'] = data_text.index<br/>documents = data_text</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"9f85\">\n          Take a peek of the data.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"9be9\">print(len(documents))<br/>print(documents[:5])</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"51eb\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            1048575\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"gv gw gx gy gz gl dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"dc dd ju\">\n           <div class=\"hl r he hm\">\n            <div class=\"jv r\">\n             <div class=\"hg hh s t u hi ai br hj hk\">\n              <img class=\"s t u hi ai ho hp hq\" height=\"279\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*9QcQgSW5CAlsJB1YiJMA2Q.png?q=20\" width=\"541\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"hg hh s t u hi ai hr\" height=\"279\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"541px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*9QcQgSW5CAlsJB1YiJMA2Q.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1082/1*9QcQgSW5CAlsJB1YiJMA2Q.png 541w\" width=\"541\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u hi ai\" height=\"279\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"541px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1082/1*9QcQgSW5CAlsJB1YiJMA2Q.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*9QcQgSW5CAlsJB1YiJMA2Q.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1082/1*9QcQgSW5CAlsJB1YiJMA2Q.png 541w\" width=\"541\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av ew hs ht hu de dc dd hv hw aq cl\">\n           Figure 1\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <h1 class=\"iq ir dt ar aq is dv it dx iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb\" id=\"9ebc\">\n          Data Pre-processing\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jc ic jd ie je ig jf ii jg ik dl\" id=\"2ccb\">\n          We will perform the following steps:\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik jw jx jy\" id=\"cb90\">\n           <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n            Tokenization\n           </strong>\n           : Split the text into sentences and the sentences into words. Lowercase the words and remove punctuation.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jz ic ka ie kb ig kc ii kd ik jw jx jy\" id=\"ccde\">\n           Words that have fewer than 3 characters are removed.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jz ic ka ie kb ig kc ii kd ik jw jx jy\" id=\"d5c9\">\n           All\n           <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n            stopwords\n           </strong>\n           are removed.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jz ic ka ie kb ig kc ii kd ik jw jx jy\" id=\"38c7\">\n           Words are\n           <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n            lemmatized\n           </strong>\n           \u2014 words in third person are changed to first person and verbs in past and future tenses are changed into present.\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jz ic ka ie kb ig kc ii kd ik jw jx jy\" id=\"2d43\">\n           Words are\n           <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n            stemmed\n           </strong>\n           \u2014 words are reduced to their root form.\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"5a5e\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           Loading gensim and nltk libraries\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"ab89\">import gensim<br/>from gensim.utils import simple_preprocess<br/>from gensim.parsing.preprocessing import STOPWORDS<br/>from nltk.stem import WordNetLemmatizer, SnowballStemmer<br/>from nltk.stem.porter import *<br/>import numpy as np<br/>np.random.seed(2018)</span><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jo jp jq jr js jm r jn\" id=\"9cc6\">import nltk<br/>nltk.download('wordnet')</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"abe2\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            [nltk_data] Downloading package wordnet to\n            <br/>\n            [nltk_data] C:\\Users\\SusanLi\\AppData\\Roaming\\nltk_data\u2026\n            <br/>\n            [nltk_data] Package wordnet is already up-to-date!\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"6e21\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            True\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"9087\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           Write a function to perform lemmatize and stem preprocessing steps on the data set\n          </strong>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"1261\">def lemmatize_stemming(text):<br/>    return stemmer.stem(WordNetLemmatizer().lemmatize(text, pos='v'))</span><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jo jp jq jr js jm r jn\" id=\"b1ad\">def preprocess(text):<br/>    result = []<br/>    for token in gensim.utils.simple_preprocess(text):<br/>        if token not in gensim.parsing.preprocessing.STOPWORDS and len(token) &gt; 3:<br/>            result.append(lemmatize_stemming(token))<br/>    return result</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"d03d\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           Select a document to preview after preprocessing\n          </strong>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"ab65\">doc_sample = documents[documents['index'] == 4310].values[0][0]</span><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jo jp jq jr js jm r jn\" id=\"a1bf\">print('original document: ')<br/>words = []<br/>for word in doc_sample.split(' '):<br/>    words.append(word)<br/>print(words)<br/>print('\\n\\n tokenized and lemmatized document: ')<br/>print(preprocess(doc_sample))</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"2ae2\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            original document:\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"7aed\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            [\u2018rain\u2019, \u2018helps\u2019, \u2018dampen\u2019, \u2018bushfires\u2019]\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"08ea\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            tokenized and lemmatized document:\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"395a\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            [\u2018rain\u2019, \u2018help\u2019, \u2018dampen\u2019, \u2018bushfir\u2019]\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"e0ae\">\n          It worked!\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"d3ec\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           Preprocess the headline text, saving the results as \u2018processed_docs\u2019\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"6e69\">processed_docs = documents['headline_text'].map(preprocess)<br/>processed_docs[:10]</span></pre>\n         <figure class=\"gv gw gx gy gz gl dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"dc dd ke\">\n           <div class=\"hl r he hm\">\n            <div class=\"kf r\">\n             <div class=\"hg hh s t u hi ai br hj hk\">\n              <img class=\"s t u hi ai ho hp hq\" height=\"299\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png?q=20\" width=\"678\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"hg hh s t u hi ai hr\" height=\"299\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"678px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1356/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png 678w\" width=\"678\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u hi ai\" height=\"299\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"678px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1356/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1356/1*pjav3VLRNQIFe1eWAqsHRA.png 678w\" width=\"678\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av ew hs ht hu de dc dd hv hw aq cl\">\n           Figure 2\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <h1 class=\"iq ir dt ar aq is dv it dx iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb\" id=\"62e8\">\n          Bag of Words on the Data set\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jc ic jd ie je ig jf ii jg ik dl\" id=\"24bf\">\n          Create a dictionary from \u2018processed_docs\u2019 containing the number of times a word appears in the training set.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"5d75\">dictionary = gensim.corpora.Dictionary(processed_docs)</span><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jo jp jq jr js jm r jn\" id=\"ab4a\">count = 0<br/>for k, v in dictionary.iteritems():<br/>    print(k, v)<br/>    count += 1<br/>    if count &gt; 10:<br/>        break</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"0ff4\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            0 broadcast\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"f260\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            1 communiti\n           </em>\n <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            10 summit\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"0cc4\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           Gensim filter_extremes\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"d538\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           Filter out tokens that appear in\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik jw jx jy\" id=\"8198\">\n           less than 15 documents (absolute number) or\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jz ic ka ie kb ig kc ii kd ik jw jx jy\" id=\"8dda\">\n           more than 0.5 documents (fraction of total corpus size, not absolute number).\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jz ic ka ie kb ig kc ii kd ik jw jx jy\" id=\"50bd\">\n           after the above two steps, keep only the first 100000 most frequent tokens.\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"b883\">dictionary.filter_extremes(no_below=15, no_above=0.5, keep_n=100000)</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"3c47\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           Gensim doc2bow\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"7854\">\n          For each document we create a dictionary reporting how many\n          <br/>\n          words and how many times those words appear. Save this to \u2018bow_corpus\u2019, then check our selected document earlier.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"63bf\">bow_corpus = [dictionary.doc2bow(doc) for doc in processed_docs]<br/>bow_corpus[4310]</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\"                        dictionary[bow_doc_4310[i][0]], <br/>bow_doc_4310[i][1]))</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"5fb7\">\n        </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"3b75\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            Word 3998 (\u201cdampen\u201d) appears 1 time.\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"iq ir dt ar aq is dv it dx iu iv iw ix iy iz ja jb\" id=\"d3d5\">\n          TF-IDF\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia jc ic jd ie je ig jf ii jg ik dl\" id=\"4b35\">\n          Create tf-idf model object using models.TfidfModel on \u2018bow_corpus\u2019 and save it to \u2018tfidf\u2019, then apply transformation to the entire corpus and call it \u2018corpus_tfidf\u2019. Finally we preview TF-IDF scores for our first document.\n         </p>\n         <pre class=\"gv gw gx gy gz jh ji ca\"><span class=\"jj ir dt ar jk b ew jl jm r jn\" id=\"3974\">from gensim import break</span></pre>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"8593\">\n          <strong class=\"hz ip\">\n           <em class=\"jt\">\n            [(0, </figure>\n         <p class=\"hx hy dt ar hz b ia ib ic id ie if ig ih ii ij ik dl\" id=\"e56e\">\n          Source code can be found on\n          <a class=\"cq fx il im in io\"            <div style=\"flex:1\">\n               <span class=\"aq b ar as at au r fg q\">\n                <div class=\"gy n o gz\">\n                 <span class=\"aq cl ex as br ha hb hc hd he
