Influencers\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o ce cf cg ch\">\n             <span class=\"aq ci cj as av ck cl\">\n              <a class=\"cm cn az ba bb bc bd be bf bg co cp bj bk cq cr\" href=\"https://medium.com/wisio/tagged/startup?source=post_page-----db3e8c0cce5e----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Startups\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o ce cf cg ch\">\n             <span class=\"aq ci cj as av ck cl\">\n              <a class=\"cm cn az ba bb bc bd be bf bg co cp bj bk cq cr\" href=\"https://medium.com/wisio/tagged/machine-learning?source=post_page-----db3e8c0cce5e----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Machine Learning\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n           </ul>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n     </div>\n    </nav>\n    <div class=\"cs ct r cu cv\">\n    </div>\n    <article>\n     <section class=\"cw cx cy cz ai da db n dc\">\n     </section>\n     <span class=\"r\">\n     </span>\n     <div>\n      <div class=\"s u dd de df dg\">\n      </div>\n      <section class=\"dh di dj dk dl\">\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dm ah ai\">\n         <div>\n          <div class=\"dn do dp ar dq b dr ds dt du dv dw dx dy dz ea eb\" id=\"eed7\">\n           <h1 class=\"dq b dr ec dt ed dv ee dx ef dz eg dp\">\n            A gentle introduction to Doc2Vec\n           </h1>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"eh\">\n           <div class=\"n ei ej ek el\">\n            <div class=\"o n\">\n             <div>\n              <a href=\"/@gidishperber?source=post_page-----db3e8c0cce5e----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               <img alt=\"Gidi Shperber\" class=\"r em en eo\" height=\"48\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/fit/c/96/96/0*F1qzwbKctxWXpQhr.jpg\" width=\"48\"/>\n              </a>\n             </div>\n             <div class=\"ep ai r\">\n              <div class=\"n\">\n               <div style=\"flex:1\">\n                <span class=\"aq b ar as at au r dp q\">\n                 <div class=\"eq n o er\">\n                  <span class=\"aq ci es as bq et eu ev ew ex dp\">\n                   <a class=\"cm cn az ba bb bc bd be bf bg ey bj bk cq cr\" href=\"/@gidishperber?source=post_page-----db3e8c0cce5e----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                    Gidi Shperber\n                   </a>\n                  </span>\n                  <div class=\"ez r an h\">\n                   <button class=\"fa dp q fb fc fd fe ff bg cq fg fh fi fj fk fl fm aq b ar fn cj au fo fp db fq fr bj\">\n                    Follow\n                   </button>\n                  </div>\n                 </div>\n                </span>\n               </div>\n              </div>\n              <span class=\"aq b ar as at au r av aw\">\n               <span class=\"aq ci es as bq et eu ev ew ex av\">\n                <div>\n                 <a class=\"cm cn az ba bb bc bd be bf bg ey bj bk cq cr\" href=\"/wisio/a-gentle-introduction-to-doc2vec-db3e8c0cce5e?source=post_page-----db3e8c0cce5e----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                  Jul 26, 2017\n                 </a>\n                 <!-- -->\n                 \u00b7\n                 <!-- -->\n                 <!-- -->\n                 8\n                 <!-- -->\n                 min read\n                </div>\n               </span>\n              </span>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n            <div class=\"n fs ft fu fv fw fx fy fz y\">\n             <div class=\"n o\">\n              <div class=\"ga r an\">\n               <a class=\"cm cn az ba bb bc bd be bf bg co cp bj bk cq cr\" href=\"//medium.com/p/db3e8c0cce5e/share/twitter?source=post_actions_header---------------------------\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n                <svg class=\"q\" height=\"29\" width=\"29\">\n                 <path d=\"M22.05 7.54a4.47 4.47 0 0 0-3.3-1.46 4.53 4.53 0 0 0-4.53 4.53c0 .35.04.7.08 1.05A12.9 12.9 0 0 1 5 6.89a5.1 5.1 0 0 0-.65 2.26c.03 1.6.83 2.99 2.02 3.79a4.3 4.3 0 0 1-2.02-.57v.08a4.55 4.55 0 0 0 3.63 4.44c-.4.08-.8.13-1.21.16l-.81-.08a4.54 4.54 0 0 0 4.2 3.15 9.56 9.56 0 0 1-5.66 1.94l-1.05-.08c2 1.27 4.38 2.02 6.94 2.02 8.3 0 12.86-6.9 12.84-12.85.02-.24 0-.43 0-.65a8.68 8.68 0 0 0 2.26-2.34c-.82.38-1.7.62-2.6.72a4.37 4.37 0 0 0 1.95-2.51c-.84.53-1.81.9-2.83 1.13z\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"ga r an\">\n               <button class=\"cm cn az ba bb bc bd be bf bg co cp bj bk cq cr\">\n                <svg class=\"q\" fill=\"none\" height=\"29\" viewbox=\"0 0 29 29\" width=\"29\">\n                 <path d=\"M5 6.36C5 5.61 5.63 5 6.4 5h16.2c.77 0 1.4.61 1.4 1.36v16.28c0 .75-.63 1.36-1.4 1.36H6.4c-.77 0-1.4-.6-1.4-1.36V6.36z\">\n                 </path>\n                 <path clip-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M10.76 20.9v-8.57H7.89v8.58h2.87zm-1.44-9.75c1 0 1.63-.65 1.63-1.48-.02-.84-.62-1.48-1.6-1.48-.99 0-1.63.64-1.63 1.48 0 .83.62 1.48 1.59 1.48h.01zM12.35 20.9h2.87v-4.79c0-.25.02-.5.1-.7.2-.5.67-1.04 1.46-1.04 1.04 0 1.46.8 1.46 1.95v4.59h2.87v-4.92c0-2.64-1.42-3.87-3.3-3.87-1.55 0-2.23.86-2.61 1.45h.02v-1.24h-2.87c.04.8 0 8.58 0 8.58z\" fill=\"#fff\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </button>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"ga r an\">\n               <a class=\"cm cn az ba bb bc bd be bf bg co cp bj bk cq cr\" href=\"//medium.com/p/db3e8c0cce5e/share/facebook?source=post_actions_header---------------------------\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n                <svg class=\"q\" height=\"29\" width=\"29\">\n                 <path d=\"M23.2 5H5.8a.8.8 0 0 0-.8.8V23.2c0 .44.35.8.8.8h9.3v-7.13h-2.38V13.9h2.38v-2.38c0-2.45 1.55-3.66 3.74-3.66 1.05 0 1.95.08 2.2.11v2.57h-1.5c-1.2 0-1.48.57-1.48 1.4v1.96h2.97l-.6 2.97h-2.37l.05 7.12h5.1a.8.8 0 0 0 .79-.8V5.8a.8.8 0 0 0-.8-.79\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gb r\">\n               <a class=\"cm cn az ba bb bc bd be bf bg co cp bj bk cq cr\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=register&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2Fwisio%2Fa-gentle-introduction-to-doc2vec-db3e8c0cce5e&amp;source=post_actions_header--------------------------bookmark_header-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                <svg height=\"25\" viewbox=\"0 0 25 25\" width=\"25\">\n                 <path d=\"M19 6a2 2 0 0 0-2-2H8a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v14.66h.01c.01.1.05.2.12.28a.5.5 0 0 0 .7.03l5.67-4.12 5.66 4.13a.5.5 0 0 0 .71-.03.5.5 0 0 0 .12-.29H19V6zm-6.84 9.97L7 19.64V6a1 1 0 0 1 1-1h9a1 1 0 0 1 1 1v13.64l-5.16-3.67a.49.49 0 0 0-.68 0z\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gc r am\">\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <h1 class=\"gd ge dp ar aq gf dr gg dt gh gi gj gk gl gm gn go\" id=\"dc79\">\n          TL;DR\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"c6f8\">\n          In this post you will learn what is\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           doc2vec\n          </strong>\n          , how it\u2019s built, how it\u2019s related to\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          , what can you do with it, hopefully with no mathematic formulas.\n         </p>\n         <blockquote class=\"he\">\n          <div class=\"hf hg hh ar dq b hi hj hk hl hm hn hc\" id=\"f07d\">\n           <p class=\"dq b ho hp av\">\n            Want to learn more? visit\n            <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"https://www.shibumi-ai.com/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n             www.shibumi-ai.com\n            </a>\n           </p>\n          </div>\n         </blockquote>\n         <h1 class=\"gd ge dp ar aq gf dr gg dt gh gi gj gk gl gm gn go\" id=\"d68a\">\n          Intro\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"8000\">\n          Numeric representation of text documents is a challenging task in machine learning. Such a representation may be used for many purposes, for example: document retrieval, web search, spam filtering, topic modeling etc.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"1116\">\n          However, there are not many good techniques to do this. Many tasks use the well known but simplistic method of\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           bag of words (BOW)\n          </strong>\n          , but outcomes will be mostly mediocre, since BOW loses many subtleties of a possible good representation, e.g consideration of word ordering.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"ecb9\">\n          Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) is also a common technique for topic modeling (extracting topics/keywords out of texts) but it\u2019s very hard to tune, and results are hard to evaluate.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"a1ba\">\n          In this post, I will review the\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           doc2vec\n          </strong>\n          method, a concept that was presented in 2014 by\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"http://see here https://arxiv.org/pdf/1405.4053v2.pdf\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n            M\n           </strong>\n          </a>\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           ikilov and Le\n          </strong>\n          in this\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/abs/1405.4053\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           article\n          </a>\n          , which we are going to mention many times through this post. Worth to mention that Mikilov is one of the authors of word2vec as well.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"2e2a\">\n          Doc2vec is a very nice technique. It\u2019s easy to use, gives good results, and as you can understand from its name, heavily based on word2vec. so we\u2019ll start with a short introduction about word2vec.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"gd ge dp ar aq gf dr gg dt gh gi gj gk gl gm gn go\" id=\"8a96\">\n          word2vec\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"b5ee\">\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          is a well known concept, used to generate representation vectors out of words.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"4d2f\">\n          There are many good tutorials online about word2vec, like\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/word2vec\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           this\n          </a>\n          one and\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"http://mccormickml.com/2016/04/19/word2vec-tutorial-the-skip-gram-model/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           this\n          </a>\n          one, but describing\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           doc2vec\n          </strong>\n          without\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          will miss the point, so I\u2019ll be brief.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"f104\">\n          In general, when you like to build some model using words, simply labeling/one-hot encoding them is a plausible way to go. However, when using such encoding, the words lose their meaning. e.g, if we encode\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           Paris\n          </em>\n          as\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           id_4\n          </em>\n          ,\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           France\n          </em>\n          as\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           id_6\n          </em>\n          and\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           power\n          </em>\n          as\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           id_8\n          </em>\n          ,\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           France\n          </em>\n          will have the same relation to\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           power\n          </em>\n          as with\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           Paris\n          </em>\n          . We would prefer a representation in which\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           France\n          </em>\n          and\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           Paris\n          </em>\n          will be closer than\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           France\n          </em>\n          and\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           power\n          </em>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"cdcf\">\n          The\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec,\n          </strong>\n          presented in 2013 in this\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/abs/1301.3781\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           article\n          </a>\n          , intends to give you just that: a numeric representation for each word, that will be able to capture such relations as above. this is part of a wider concept in machine learning \u2014 the feature vectors.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"5949\">\n          Such representations, encapsulate different relations between words, like synonyms, antonyms, or analogies, such as this one:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig cy cz paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"cy cz ia\">\n           <div class=\"im r in io\">\n            <div class=\"ip r\">\n             <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"360\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/54/1*keqyBCQ5FL6A7DZLrXamvQ.png?q=20\" width=\"327\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"360\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"327px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*keqyBCQ5FL6A7DZLrXamvQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/654/1*keqyBCQ5FL6A7DZLrXamvQ.png 327w\" width=\"327\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"360\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"327px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/654/1*keqyBCQ5FL6A7DZLrXamvQ.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*keqyBCQ5FL6A7DZLrXamvQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/654/1*keqyBCQ5FL6A7DZLrXamvQ.png 327w\" width=\"327\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av es iu iv iw da cy cz ix iy aq ci\">\n           fig 1: king to queen is like man to woman. it is illegal to write about\n           <strong class=\"aq hd\">\n            word2vec\n           </strong>\n           without attaching this plot\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <h2 class=\"iz ge dp ar aq gf ja jb jc jd je jf jg jh ji jj jk\" id=\"1968\">\n          Word2vec algorithms\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"fbb0\">\n          So how is it done? word2vec representation is created using 2 algorithms: Continuous Bag-of-Words model (\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           CBOW\n          </strong>\n          ) and the\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           Skip-Gram\n          </strong>\n          model.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"iz ge dp ar aq gf ja jb jc jd je jf jg jh ji jj jk\" id=\"ba95\">\n          Continuous bag of words\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"6d93\">\n          Continuous bag of words creates a sliding window around current word, to predict it from \u201ccontext\u201d \u2014 the surrounding words. Each word is represented as a feature vector. After training, these vectors become the word vectors.\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig cy cz paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"cy cz jl\">\n           <div class=\"im r in io\">\n            <div class=\"jm r\">\n             <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"208\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*TRsyvDhPB6_KCimEk-2kWQ.png?q=20\" width=\"332\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"208\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"332px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*TRsyvDhPB6_KCimEk-2kWQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/664/1*TRsyvDhPB6_KCimEk-2kWQ.png 332w\" width=\"332\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"208\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"332px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/664/1*TRsyvDhPB6_KCimEk-2kWQ.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*TRsyvDhPB6_KCimEk-2kWQ.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/664/1*TRsyvDhPB6_KCimEk-2kWQ.png 332w\" width=\"332\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av es iu iv iw da cy cz ix iy aq ci\">\n           fig 2: CBOW algorithm sketch: the words \u201cthe\u201d \u201ccat\u201d \u201csat\u201d are used to predict the word \u201con\u201d\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"0218\">\n          As said before, vectors which represent similar words are close by different distance metrics, and additioanly encapsualte numeric relations, such as the\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           king-queen=man\n          </em>\n          from above.\n         </p>\n         <h2 class=\"iz ge dp ar aq gf ja jb jc jd je jf jg jh ji jj jk\" id=\"ed90\">\n          Skip gram\n         </h2>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"1b29\">\n          The second algorithm (described in the same article, and well explaiend\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"http://mccormickml.com/2016/04/19/word2vec-tutorial-the-skip-gram-model/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           here\n          </a>\n          ) is actaully the opposite of CBOW: instead of prediciting one word each time, we use 1 word to predict all surrounding words (\u201ccontext\u201d).\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           Skip gram\n          </strong>\n          is much slower than CBOW, but considered more accurate with infrequent words.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"gd ge dp ar aq gf dr gg dt gh gi gj gk gl gm gn go\" id=\"e551\">\n          Doc2vec\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"61d5\">\n          After hopefully understanding what\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          is, it will be easier to understand how\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           doc2vec\n          </strong>\n          works.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"561e\">\n          As said, the goal of\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           doc2vec\n          </strong>\n          is to create a numeric representation of a document, regardless of its length. But unlike words, documents do not come in logical structures such as words, so the another method has to be found.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"f6f0\">\n          The concept that Mikilov and Le have used was simple, yet clever: they have used the\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          model, and added another vector (Paragraph ID below), like so:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig cy cz paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"cy cz jn\">\n           <div class=\"im r in io\">\n            <div class=\"jo r\">\n             <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"270\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*x-gtU4UlO8FAsRvL.?q=20\" width=\"486\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"270\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"486px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*x-gtU4UlO8FAsRvL. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/972/0*x-gtU4UlO8FAsRvL. 486w\" width=\"486\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"270\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"486px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/972/0*x-gtU4UlO8FAsRvL.\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*x-gtU4UlO8FAsRvL. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/972/0*x-gtU4UlO8FAsRvL. 486w\" width=\"486\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av es iu iv iw da cy cz ix iy aq ci\">\n           fig 3: PV-DM model\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"deb7\">\n          If you feel familiar with the sketch above, it\u2019s because it is a small extension to the CBOW model. But instead of using just words to predict the next word, we also added another feature vector, which is document-unique.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"a393\">\n          So, when training the word vectors W, the document vector D is trained as well, and in the end of training, it holds a numeric representation of the document.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"d8f1\">\n          The model above is called\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           Distributed Memory version of Paragraph Vector\n          </em>\n          (PV-DM). It acts as a memory that remembers what is missing from the current context \u2014 or as the topic of the paragraph. While the word vectors represent the concept of a word, the document vector intends to represent the concept of a document.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"dd49\">\n          As in word2vec, another algorithm, which is similar to skip-gram may be used Distributed Bag of\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           Words version of Paragraph Vector\n          </strong>\n          (PV-DBOW)\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig cy cz paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"cy cz jp\">\n           <div class=\"im r in io\">\n            <div class=\"jq r\">\n             <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"275\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*NtIsrbd4VQzUKVKr.?q=20\" width=\"440\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"275\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"440px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*NtIsrbd4VQzUKVKr. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/880/0*NtIsrbd4VQzUKVKr. 440w\" width=\"440\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"275\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"440px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/880/0*NtIsrbd4VQzUKVKr.\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*NtIsrbd4VQzUKVKr. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/880/0*NtIsrbd4VQzUKVKr. 440w\" width=\"440\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av es iu iv iw da cy cz ix iy aq ci\">\n           fig 4: PV-DBOW model\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"0b0e\">\n          Here, this algorithm is actually faster (as opposed to\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          ) and consumes less memory, since there is no need to save the word vectors.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"1410\">\n          In the article, the authors state that they recommend using a combination of both algorithms, though the\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           PV-DM\n          </strong>\n          model is superior and usually will achieve state of the art results by itself.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"a79d\">\n          The\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           doc2vec\n          </strong>\n          models may be used in the following way: for training, a set of documents is required. A word vector\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           W\n          </strong>\n          is generated for each word, and a document vector\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           D\n          </strong>\n          is generated for each document. The model also trains weights for a softmax hidden layer. In the inference stage, a new document may be presented, and all weights are fixed to calculate the document vector.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"gd ge dp ar aq gf dr gg dt gh gi gj gk gl gm gn go\" id=\"53e8\">\n          Evaluating model and some thoughts\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"8a25\">\n          The thing with this kind of unsupervised models, is that they are not trained to do the task they are intended for. E.g,\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          is trained to complete surrounding words in corpus, but is used to estimate similarity or relations between words. As such, measuring the performance of these algorithms may be challenging. We already saw the\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           king ,queen,man, woman\n          </em>\n          example, but we want to make form it a rigorous way to evaluate machine learning models.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"c82c\">\n          Therefore, when training these algorithms, we should be minded to relevant metrics. One possible metric for\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          , is a generalization of the above example, and is called\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/pdf/1310.4546.pdf\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           analogical reasoning\n          </a>\n          . It contains many analogical combinations, here are some:\n         </p>\n         <ul class=\"\">\n          <li class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc jr js jt\" id=\"c717\">\n           <em class=\"hz\">\n            happy happily \u2014 furious furiously\n           </em>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs ju gu jv gw jw gy jx ha jy hc jr js jt\" id=\"fa62\">\n           <em class=\"hz\">\n            immediate immediately \u2014 infrequent infrequently\n           </em>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs ju gu jv gw jw gy jx ha jy hc jr js jt\" id=\"4292\">\n           <em class=\"hz\">\n            slowing slowed \u2014 sleeping slept\n           </em>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs ju gu jv gw jw gy jx ha jy hc jr js jt\" id=\"560f\">\n           <em class=\"hz\">\n            spending spent \u2014 striking struck\n           </em>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"8c04\">\n          A success in this task is getting very close results when caclulating distances between matching pairs.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"1a03\">\n          Dataset is availible at\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"http://download.tensorflow.org/data/questions-words.txt\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           http://download.tensorflow.org/data/questions-words.txt\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"742e\">\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           Doc2vec\n          </strong>\n          was tested in the article on 2 tasks: the first is\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           sentiment analysis\n          </strong>\n          , and the second one is similar to the analogical reasoning above.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"52a3\">\n          Here are 3 paragraphs from the article. a dataset of such paragraphs was used to compare models. it is easy to see which 2 should be closer:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig cy cz paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"cy cz jz\">\n           <div class=\"im r in io\">\n            <div class=\"ka r\">\n             <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"97\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*29C_YihnTRwscPg_.?q=20\" width=\"483\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"97\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"483px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*29C_YihnTRwscPg_. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/966/0*29C_YihnTRwscPg_. 483w\" width=\"483\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"97\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"483px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/966/0*29C_YihnTRwscPg_.\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*29C_YihnTRwscPg_. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/966/0*29C_YihnTRwscPg_. 483w\" width=\"483\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig cy cz paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"cy cz kb\">\n           <div class=\"im r in io\">\n            <div class=\"kc r\">\n             <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"235\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*IxtS5B7eZOl8g2Pf.?q=20\" width=\"473\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"235\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"473px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*IxtS5B7eZOl8g2Pf. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/946/0*IxtS5B7eZOl8g2Pf. 473w\" width=\"473\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"235\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"473px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/946/0*IxtS5B7eZOl8g2Pf.\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*IxtS5B7eZOl8g2Pf. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/946/0*IxtS5B7eZOl8g2Pf. 473w\" width=\"473\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"b58b\">\n          This dataset (was not shared as far as I know) was used to compare some models, and\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           doc2vec\n          </strong>\n          came out as the best:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig cy cz paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"cy cz kd\">\n           <div class=\"im r in io\">\n            <div class=\"ke r\">\n             <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"165\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*necLj-wWmZxbgwAW.?q=20\" width=\"350\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"165\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"350px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*necLj-wWmZxbgwAW. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/700/0*necLj-wWmZxbgwAW. 350w\" width=\"350\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"165\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"350px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/700/0*necLj-wWmZxbgwAW.\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*necLj-wWmZxbgwAW. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/700/0*necLj-wWmZxbgwAW. 350w\" width=\"350\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <h1 class=\"gd ge dp ar aq gf dr gg dt gh gi gj gk gl gm gn go\" id=\"c339\">\n          Real life challenge \u2014 Wisio\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"6b44\">\n          One of my clients,\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"http://www.wisio.com\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n            <em class=\"hz\">\n             Wisio\n            </em>\n           </strong>\n          </a>\n          , uses machine learning methods to match \u201c\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Influencer_marketing\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           influencer\n          </a>\n          \u201d you-tube videos to content-articles. Doc2vec seems to be a great method for such match.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"55d3\">\n          Here is an example for what the\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"http://www.wisio.com\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Wisio\n          </a>\n          does: in this\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"http://www.hometalk.com/16937846/stump-solar-lights?expand_all_questions=1\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           article\n          </a>\n          , about home made lights in a tree stump, you may see at the bottom 4 related video about woodworking stuff:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig cy cz paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"kg kh in ki ai\">\n           <div class=\"cy cz kf\">\n            <div class=\"im r in io\">\n             <div class=\"kj r\">\n              <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n               <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"525\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR.?q=20\" width=\"809\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"525\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR. 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR. 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR. 700w\" width=\"809\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"525\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1618/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR.\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR. 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR. 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR. 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*V94DVFe9WYHv-UpR. 700w\" width=\"809\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av es iu iv iw da cy cz ix iy aq ci\">\n           Wisio\u2019s recommended videos for the above article\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"7a56\">\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           Wisio\u2019s\n          </strong>\n          current model uses tagging mechanism to tag the videos and the articles (\u201ctopic modeling\u201d) and measuring distance between tags.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"14c2\">\n          Wisio has a few corpora of text, related to the themes of its\u2019 clients. E.g, there is a 100K manually tagged documents about \u201cdo it yourself\u201d, for publishers such as above. There are 17 possible tags for each article (e.g, \u201chome decor\u201d, \u201cgardening\u201d, \u201cremodeling and renovating\u201d etc.). For this experiment, we decided trying to predict the tags using doc2vec and some other models.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"b431\">\n          Wisio\u2019s current best model was a convolutional neural network, on top of\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          , which achieved accuracy of around\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           70%\n          </strong>\n          in predicting the tags for the documents (as described\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"https://quid.com/feed/how-quid-uses-deep-learning-with-small-data\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           here\n          </a>\n          ).\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"4bd9\">\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           Doc2vec\n          </strong>\n          model by itself is an unsupervised method, so it should be tweaked a little bit to \u201cparticipate\u201d in this contest. Fortunately, as in most cases, we can use some tricks: If you recall, in\n          <em class=\"hz\">\n           fig 3\n          </em>\n          we added another document vector, which was unique for each document. If you think about it, it is possible to add more vectors, which don\u2019t have to be unique: for example, if we have tags for our documents (as we actually have), we can add them, and get their representation as vectors.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"427c\">\n          Additionally, they don\u2019t have to be unique. This way, we can add to the unique document tag one of our 17 tags, and create a doc2vec representation for them as well! see below:\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig cy cz paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"kg kh in ki ai\">\n           <div class=\"cy cz kk\">\n            <div class=\"im r in io\">\n             <div class=\"kl r\">\n              <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n               <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"234\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*YfOv1_8tmTiahgbpEt5LCw.png?q=20\" width=\"422\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"234\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"422px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*YfOv1_8tmTiahgbpEt5LCw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/844/1*YfOv1_8tmTiahgbpEt5LCw.png 422w\" width=\"422\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"234\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"422px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/844/1*YfOv1_8tmTiahgbpEt5LCw.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*YfOv1_8tmTiahgbpEt5LCw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/844/1*YfOv1_8tmTiahgbpEt5LCw.png 422w\" width=\"422\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av es iu iv iw da cy cz ix iy aq ci\">\n           fig 5 \u2014 doc2vec model with tag vector\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"3683\">\n          we will use\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           gensim\n          </strong>\n          <a class=\"cm fr hq hr hs ht\" href=\"https://rare-technologies.com/doc2vec-tutorial/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n            implementation\n           </strong>\n          </a>\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n          </strong>\n          of\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           doc2vec.\n          </strong>\n          here is how the gensim TaggedDocument object looks like:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"ig\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"km kn ko kp kq kr ae ks af kt ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig ku kv paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"kg kh in ki ai\">\n            <div class=\"cy cz ag\">\n             <div class=\"im r in io\">\n              <div class=\"kw r\">\n               <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n                <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"125\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png?q=20\" width=\"1151\"/>\n               </div>\n               <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"125\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 992w, https://miro.medium.com/max/2000/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 1000w\" width=\"1151\"/>\n               <noscript>\n                <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"125\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2302/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1456/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 728w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1632/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 816w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1808/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 904w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1984/1*As22mK8YKolvVFCGmHvGxw.png 992w,         <figcaption class=\"av es iu iv iw da cy cz ix iy aq ci\">\n            gensim TaggedDocument object. SENT_3 is the unique document id, remodeling and renovating is the tag\n           </figcaption>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dm ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"07d5\">\n          Using\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           gensim\n          </strong>\n          doc2vec is very straight-forward. As always, model should be initialized, trained for a few epochs:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"ig\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"km kn ko kp kq kr ae ks af kt ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig ku kv paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"kg kh in ki ai\">\n            <div class=\"cy cz kx\">\n             <div class=\"im r in io\">\n              <div class=\"ky r\">\n               <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n                <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"306\" </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af hd\">\n           document\n          </strong>\n          to every\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           tag\n          </strong>\n          , this way:\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"ig\">\n        <div class=\"n p\">\n         <div class=\"km kn ko kp kq kr ae ks af kt ah ai\">\n          <figure class=\"ib ic id ie if ig ku kv paragraph-image\">\n           <div class=\"kg kh in ki ai\">\n            <div class=\"cy cz ag\">\n             <div class=\"im r in io\">\n              <div class=\"kz r\">\n               <div class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai bq ik il\">\n                <img class=\"s t u ij ai iq ir is\" height=\"61\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/1*T9swFeb7vqTOWKA9NNnIDA.png?q=20\" width=\"1180\"/>\n               </div>\n               <img class=\"ih ii s t u ij ai it\" height=\"61\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/1*T9swFeb7vqTOWKA9NNnIDA.png 276w, <img class=\"s t u ij ai\" height=\"61\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"1000px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2360/1*T9swFeb7vqTOWKA9NNnIDA.png\"        </figure>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dm ah ai\">\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"e1dd\">\n          The tag with highest similarity to document will be predicted.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"97c8\">\n          Using this method, with training only on 10K out of our 100K articles, we have reached accuracy of 74%, better than before.\n         </p>\n         <h1 class=\"gd ge dp ar aq gf dr gg dt gh gi gj gk gl gm gn go\" id=\"a127\">\n          Summary\n         </h1>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs gt gu gv gw gx gy gz ha hb hc dh\" id=\"ce78\">\n          We have seen that with some tweaking, we can get much more from an already very useful\n          <strong class=\"gr hd\">\n           word2vec\n          </strong>\n          model. This is great, because as said before, in my opinion representation of documents for tagging and matching has still a way to go.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"ca5d\">\n          Additionally, this shows that this is a great example for how machine learning models encapsulate much more abilities besides the specific task they were trained for. This can be seen in deep CNNs, which are trained for object classification, but can also be used for semantic segmentation or clustering images.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"ecda\">\n          To conclude, if you have some document related task \u2014 this may be great model for you!\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gp gq dp ar gr b gs hu gu hv gw hw gy hx ha hy hc dh\" id=\"1ae4\">\n          Feel free to comment and correct. if there will be enough interest, I\u2019ll share the code.\n         </p>\n         <blockquote class=\"he\">\n          <div class=\"hf hg hh ar dq b hi hj hk hl hm hn hc\" id=\"6881\">\n           <p class=\"dq b ho hp av\">\n            E\n            <!-- -->\n            njoyed the article? general, when you like to build some model using words, simply labeling\\u002Fone-hot encoding them is a plausible way to go. However, when using such encoding, the words lose their meaning. e.g, if we encode Paris as id_4, France as id_6 and power as id_8, France will have the same relation to power as with Paris. We would prefer a representation in which France and Paris will be closer than France and E.g, word2vec is trained to complete surrounding words in corpus, but is used to estimate similarity or relations between words. As such, measuring the performance of these algorithms may be challenging. 2000ms infinite cubic-bezier(.1,.12,.25,1)}.ld{transition:fill 200ms ease}\n  </style>\n  <style data-fela-rehydration=\"460\" data-fela-type=\"RULE\" media=\"all and (max-width: 1230px)\" type=\"text/css\">\n   .iz{display:none}\n  </style>\n  <style data-fela-rehydration=\"460\" data-fela-type=\"RULE\" media=\"all and (max-width: 1198px)\" type=\"text/css\">\n   .jb{display:none}\n  </style>\n </head>\n <body>\n  <div id=\"root\">\n   <div class=\"a b c\">\n    <div class=\"d e f g h i j k\">\n    </div>\n    <script>\n     document.domain = document.domain;\n    </script>\n    <script>\n     window.PARSELY = window.PARSELY || {autotrack: false}\n    </script>\n    <nav class=\"r s t u v c w x y\">\n     <div>\n      <div class=\"r c\">\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af ag ah ai\">\n         <div class=\"aj n o ak al\">\n          <div class=\"n o am w\">\n           <a aria-label=\"Homepage\" href=\"https://medium.com/?source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n            <svg class=\"q\" height=\"35\" viewbox=\"5 5 35 35\" width=\"35\">\n             <path d=\"M5 40V5h35v35H5zm8.56-12.63c0 .56-.03.69-.32 1.03L10.8 31.4v.4h6.97v-.4L15.3 28.4c-.29-.34-.34-.5-.34-1.03v-8.95l6.13 13.36h.71l5.26-13.36v10.64c0 .3 0 .35-.19.53l-1.85 1.8v.4h9.2v-.4l-1.83-1.8c-.18-.18-.2-.24-.2-.53V15.94c0-.3.02-.35.2-.53l1.82-1.8v-.4h-6.47l-4.62 11.55-5.2-11.54h-6.8v.4l2.15 2.63c.24.3.29.37.29.77v10.35z\">\n             </path>\n            </svg>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"r an w\">\n           <div class=\"n o\">\n            <div class=\"n g\">\n             <div class=\"ao\" id=\"lo-post-page-navbar-sign-in-link\">\n              <div class=\"ap r\">\n               <span class=\"aq b ar as at au r av aw\">\n                <a class=\"ax ay az ba bb bc bd be bf bg bh bi bj bk bl bm\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=login&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fintroduction-to-word-embedding-and-word2vec-652d0c2060fa&amp;source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                 Sign in\n                </a>\n               </span>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class=\"bn r bo bp\">\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af ag ah ai\">\n         <div class=\"bq br n o\">\n          <div class=\"bs r an\">\n           <a href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/?source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n            <div class=\"bt bu r\">\n             <img alt=\"Towards Data Science\" class=\"\" height=\"36\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/200/1*mG6i4Bh_LgixUYXJgQpYsg@2x.png\" width=\"100\"/>\n            </div>\n           </a>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"bv r bw\">\n           <ul class=\"bx bf by bz ca n cb g cc cd ce\">\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/data-science/home?source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Machine Learning\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/programming/home?source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Programming\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/data-visualization/home?source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Visualization\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" </span>\n            </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\"  </li>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\"     </li>\n            <span class=\"cf cj ck\">\n            </span>\n            <li class=\"n o cf cg ch ci\">\n             <span class=\"aq cl cm as cn co cp\">\n              <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg cs ct bj bk cu cv\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/contribute/home?source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               Contribute\n              </a>\n             </span>\n            </li>\n           </ul>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n     </div>\n    </nav>\n    <div class=\"cw cx r cy cz\">\n    </div>\n    <article>\n     <section class=\"da db dc dd ai de df n dg\">\n     </section>\n     <span class=\"r\">\n     </span>\n     <div>\n      <div class=\"s u dh di dj dk\">\n      </div>\n      <section class=\"dl dm dn do dp\">\n       <div class=\"n p\">\n        <div class=\"z ab ac ae af dq ah ai\">\n         <div>\n          <div class=\"dr ds dt ar du b dv dw dx dy dz ea eb ec ed ee ef\" id=\"86b4\">\n           <h1 class=\"du b dv eg dx eh dz ei eb ej ed ek dt\">\n            Introduction to Word Embedding and Word2Vec\n           </h1>\n          </div>\n          <div class=\"el\">\n           <div class=\"n em en eo ep\">\n            <div class=\"o n\">\n             <div>\n              <a href=\"/@karanidhruvil?source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n               <div class=\"eq er es\">\n                <div class=\"et n eu o p s ev ew ex ey ez dk\">\n                 <svg height=\"57\" viewbox=\"0 0 57 57\" width=\"57\">\n                  <path clip-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M28.5 1.2A27.45 27.45 0 0 0 4.06 15.82L3 15.27A28.65 28.65 0 0 1 28.5 0C39.64 0 49.29 6.2 54 15.27l-1.06.55A27.45 27.45 0 0 0 28.5 1.2zM4.06 41.18A27.45 27.45 0 0 0 28.5 55.8a27.45 27.45 0 0 0 24.44-14.62l1.06.55A28.65 28.65 0 0 1 28.5 57 28.65 28.65 0 0 1 3 41.73l1.06-.55z\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n                  </path>\n                 </svg>\n                </div>\n                <img alt=\"Dhruvil Karani\" class=\"r fa es er\" height=\"48\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/fit/c/96/96/1*pD4aH2ZLYLWqiqo49upd7A.jpeg\" width=\"48\"/>\n               </div>\n              </a>\n             </div>\n             <div class=\"fb ai r\">\n              <div class=\"n\">\n               <div style=\"flex:1\">\n                <span class=\"aq b ar as at au r dt q\">\n                 <div class=\"fc n o fd\">\n                  <span class=\"aq cl fe as br ff fg fh fi fj dt\">\n                   <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg fk bj bk fl fm\" href=\"/@karanidhruvil?source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                    Dhruvil Karani\n                   </a>\n                  </span>\n                  <div class=\"fn r an h\">\n                   <a class=\"fo dt q fp fq fr fs ft bg fl fu fv fw fx fy fz ga aq b ar gb cm au gc gd df ge gf bj\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=register&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fintroduction-to-word-embedding-and-word2vec-652d0c2060fa&amp;source=-8f59d024f067-------------------------follow_byline-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                    Follow\n                   </a>\n                  </div>\n                 </div>\n                </span>\n               </div>\n              </div>\n              <span class=\"aq b ar as at au r av aw\">\n               <span class=\"aq cl fe as br ff fg fh fi fj av\">\n                <div>\n                 <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg fk bj bk fl fm\" href=\"/introduction-to-word-embedding-and-word2vec-652d0c2060fa?source=post_page-----652d0c2060fa----------------------\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                  Sep 1, 2018\n                 </a>\n                 <!-- -->\n                 \u00b7\n                 <!-- -->\n                 <!-- -->\n                 5\n                 <!-- -->\n                 min read\n                </div>\n               </span>\n              </span>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n            <div class=\"n gg gh gi gj gk gl gm gn y\">\n             <div class=\"n o\">\n              <div class=\"go r an\">\n               <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gp gq bj bk fl fm\" href=\"//medium.com/p/652d0c2060fa/share/twitter?source=post_actions_header---------------------------\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n                <svg class=\"q\" height=\"29\" width=\"29\">\n                 <path d=\"M22.05 7.54a4.47 4.47 0 0 0-3.3-1.46 4.53 4.53 0 0 0-4.53 4.53c0 .35.04.7.08 1.05A12.9 12.9 0 0 1 5 6.89a5.1 5.1 0 0 0-.65 2.26c.03 1.6.83 2.99 2.02 3.79a4.3 4.3 0 0 1-2.02-.57v.08a4.55 4.55 0 0 0 3.63 4.44c-.4.08-.8.13-1.21.16l-.81-.08a4.54 4.54 0 0 0 4.2 3.15 9.56 9.56 0 0 1-5.66 1.94l-1.05-.08c2 1.27 4.38 2.02 6.94 2.02 8.3 0 12.86-6.9 12.84-12.85.02-.24 0-.43 0-.65a8.68 8.68 0 0 0 2.26-2.34c-.82.38-1.7.62-2.6.72a4.37 4.37 0 0 0 1.95-2.51c-.84.53-1.81.9-2.83 1.13z\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"go r an\">\n               <button class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gp gq bj bk fl fm\">\n                <svg class=\"q\" fill=\"none\" height=\"29\" viewbox=\"0 0 29 29\" width=\"29\">\n                 <path d=\"M5 6.36C5 5.61 5.63 5 6.4 5h16.2c.77 0 1.4.61 1.4 1.36v16.28c0 .75-.63 1.36-1.4 1.36H6.4c-.77 0-1.4-.6-1.4-1.36V6.36z\">\n                 </path>\n                 <path clip-rule=\"evenodd\" d=\"M10.76 20.9v-8.57H7.89v8.58h2.87zm-1.44-9.75c1 0 1.63-.65 1.63-1.48-.02-.84-.62-1.48-1.6-1.48-.99 0-1.63.64-1.63 1.48 0 .83.62 1.48 1.59 1.48h.01zM12.35 20.9h2.87v-4.79c0-.25.02-.5.1-.7.2-.5.67-1.04 1.46-1.04 1.04 0 1.46.8 1.46 1.95v4.59h2.87v-4.92c0-2.64-1.42-3.87-3.3-3.87-1.55 0-2.23.86-2.61 1.45h.02v-1.24h-2.87c.04.8 0 8.58 0 8.58z\" fill=\"#fff\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </button>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"go r an\">\n               <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gp gq bj bk fl fm\" href=\"//medium.com/p/652d0c2060fa/share/facebook?source=post_actions_header---------------------------\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n                <svg class=\"q\" height=\"29\" width=\"29\">\n                 <path d=\"M23.2 5H5.8a.8.8 0 0 0-.8.8V23.2c0 .44.35.8.8.8h9.3v-7.13h-2.38V13.9h2.38v-2.38c0-2.45 1.55-3.66 3.74-3.66 1.05 0 1.95.08 2.2.11v2.57h-1.5c-1.2 0-1.48.57-1.48 1.4v1.96h2.97l-.6 2.97h-2.37l.05 7.12h5.1a.8.8 0 0 0 .79-.8V5.8a.8.8 0 0 0-.8-.79\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gr r\">\n               <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gp gq bj bk fl fm\" href=\"https://medium.com/m/signin?operation=register&amp;redirect=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fintroduction-to-word-embedding-and-word2vec-652d0c2060fa&amp;source=post_actions_header--------------------------bookmark_header-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n                <svg height=\"25\" viewbox=\"0 0 25 25\" width=\"25\">\n                 <path d=\"M19 6a2 2 0 0 0-2-2H8a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v14.66h.01c.01.1.05.2.12.28a.5.5 0 0 0 .7.03l5.67-4.12 5.66 4.13a.5.5 0 0 0 .71-.03.5.5 0 0 0 .12-.29H19V6zm-6.84 9.97L7 19.64V6a1 1 0 0 1 1-1h9a1 1 0 0 1 1 1v13.64l-5.16-3.67a.49.49 0 0 0-.68 0z\" fill-rule=\"evenodd\">\n                 </path>\n                </svg>\n               </a>\n              </div>\n              <div class=\"gs r am\">\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </div>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"5faa\">\n          Word embedding is one of the most popular representation of document vocabulary. It is capable of capturing context of a word in a document, semantic and syntactic similarity, relation with other words, etc.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"2242\">\n          What are word embeddings exactly? Loosely speaking, they are vector representations of a particular word. Having said this, what follows is how do we generate them? More importantly, how do they capture the context?\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"a3c3\">\n          Word2Vec is one of the most popular technique to learn word embeddings using shallow neural network. It was developed by\n          <a class=\"cq gf hh hi hj hk\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/pdf/1310.4546.pdf\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           Tomas Mikolov in 2013 at Google\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"1e47\">\n          Let\u2019s tackle this part by part.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"9715\">\n          <strong class=\"gv hl\">\n           Why do we need them?\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"63f5\">\n          Consider the following similar sentences:\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           Have a good day\n          </em>\n          and\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           Have a great day.\n          </em>\n          They hardly have different meaning. If we construct an exhaustive vocabulary (let\u2019s call it V), it would have V = {Have, a, good, great, day}.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"23d4\">\n          Now, let us create a one-hot encoded vector for each of these words in V. Length of our one-hot encoded vector would be equal to the size of V (=5). We would have a vector of zeros except for the element at the index representing the corresponding word in the vocabulary. That particular element would be one. The encodings below would explain this better.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"848b\">\n          Have = [1,0,0,0,0]`; a=[0,1,0,0,0]` ; good=[0,0,1,0,0]` ; great=[0,0,0,1,0]` ; day=[0,0,0,0,1]` (` represents transpose)\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"f450\">\n          If we try to visualize these encodings, we can think of a 5 dimensional space, where each word occupies one of the dimensions and has nothing to do with the rest (no projection along the other dimensions). This means \u2018good\u2019 and \u2018great\u2019 are as different as \u2018day\u2019 and \u2018have\u2019, which is not true.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"919e\">\n          Our objective is to have words with similar context occupy close spatial positions. Mathematically, the cosine of the angle between such vectors should be close to 1, i.e. angle close to 0.\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ho hp hq hr hs ht dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"dc dd hn\">\n           <div class=\"hz r eq ia\">\n            <div class=\"ib r\">\n             <div class=\"hu hv s t u hw ai br hx hy\">\n              <img class=\"s t u hw ai ic id ie\" height=\"535\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png?q=20\" width=\"697\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"hu hv s t u hw ai if\" height=\"535\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"697px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1394/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png 697w\" width=\"697\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u hw ai\" height=\"535\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"697px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1394/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1394/0*XMW5mf81LSHodnTi.png 697w\" width=\"697\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av fe ig ih ii de dc dd ij ik aq cl\">\n           <a class=\"cq gf hh hi hj hk\" href=\"http://i0.wp.com/techinpink.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/cosine.png\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            Google Images\n           </a>\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"3327\">\n          Here comes the idea of generating\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           distributed representations\n          </em>\n          . Intuitively, we introduce some\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           dependence\n          </em>\n          of one word on the other words. The words in context of this word would get a greater share of this\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           dependence.\n          </em>\n          In one hot encoding representations, all the words are\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           independent\n          </em>\n          of each other\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           ,\n          </em>\n          as mentioned earlier.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"6f41\">\n          <strong class=\"gv hl\">\n           How does Word2Vec work?\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"6aa0\">\n          Word2Vec is a method to construct such an embedding. It can be obtained using two methods (both involving Neural Networks): Skip Gram and Common Bag Of Words (CBOW)\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"6b40\">\n          <strong class=\"gv hl\">\n           <em class=\"hm\">\n            CBOW Model:\n           </em>\n          </strong>\n          This method takes the context of each word as the input and tries to predict the word corresponding to the context. Consider our example:\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           Have a great day.\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"c76a\">\n          Let the input to the Neural Network be the word,\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           great.\n          </em>\n          Notice that here we are trying to predict a target word (\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           d\n          </em>\n          ay\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           )\n          </em>\n          using a single context input word\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           great.\n          </em>\n          More specifically, we use the one hot encoding of the input word and measure the output error compared to one hot encoding of the target word (\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           d\n          </em>\n          ay).\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n          </em>\n          In the process of predicting the target word, we learn the vector representation of the target word.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"f10b\">\n          Let us look deeper into the actual architecture.\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ho hp hq hr hs ht dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"im in eq io ai\">\n           <div class=\"dc dd il\">\n            <div class=\"hz r eq ia\">\n             <div class=\"ip r\">\n              <div class=\"hu hv s t u hw ai br hx hy\">\n               <img class=\"s t u hw ai ic id ie\" height=\"744\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png?q=20\" width=\"1400\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"hu hv s t u hw ai if\" height=\"744\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png 700w\" width=\"1400\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u hw ai\" height=\"744\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2800/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*3DFDpaXoglalyB4c.png 700w\" width=\"1400\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av fe ig ih ii de dc dd ij ik aq cl\">\n           <a class=\"cq gf hh hi hj hk\" href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/sAvR9.png\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            CBOW Model\n           </a>\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"9809\">\n          The input or the context word is a one hot encoded vector of size V. The hidden layer contains N neurons and the output is again a V length vector with the elements being the softmax values.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"1ff8\">\n          Let\u2019s get the terms in the picture right:\n          <br/>\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           - Wvn is the weight matrix that maps the input x to the hidden layer (V*N dimensional matrix)\n           <br/>\n          </em>\n          -\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           W`nv is the weight matrix that maps the hidden layer outputs to the final output layer (N*V dimensional matrix)\n          </em>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"fd35\">\n          I won\u2019t get into the mathematics. We\u2019ll just get an idea of what\u2019s going on.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"4d7a\">\n          The hidden layer neurons just copy the weighted sum of inputs to the next layer. There is no activation like sigmoid, tanh or ReLU. The only non-linearity is the softmax calculations in the output layer.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"483b\">\n          But, the above model used a single context word to predict the target. We can use multiple context words to do the same.\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ho hp hq hr hs ht dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"dc dd iq\">\n           <div class=\"hz r eq ia\">\n            <div class=\"ir r\">\n             <div class=\"hu hv s t u hw ai br hx hy\">\n              <img class=\"s t u hw ai ic id ie\" height=\"575\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/60/0*CCsrTAjN80MqswXG?q=20\" width=\"596\"/>\n             </div>\n             <img class=\"hu hv s t u hw ai if\" height=\"575\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"596px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*CCsrTAjN80MqswXG 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*CCsrTAjN80MqswXG 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1192/0*CCsrTAjN80MqswXG 596w\" width=\"596\"/>\n             <noscript>\n              <img class=\"s t u hw ai\" height=\"575\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"596px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/1192/0*CCsrTAjN80MqswXG\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*CCsrTAjN80MqswXG 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*CCsrTAjN80MqswXG 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1192/0*CCsrTAjN80MqswXG 596w\" width=\"596\"/>\n             </noscript>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n          <figcaption class=\"av fe ig ih ii de dc dd ij ik aq cl\">\n           <a class=\"cq gf hh hi hj hk\" href=\"http://www.stokastik.in/understanding-word-vectors-and-word2vec/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n            Google images\n           </a>\n          </figcaption>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"bee3\">\n          The above model takes C context words. When\n          <em class=\"hm\">\n           Wvn\n          </em>\n          is used to calculate hidden layer inputs, we take an average over all these C context word inputs.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"ae5e\">\n          So, we have seen how word representations are generated using the context words. But there\u2019s one more way we can do the same. We can use the target word (whose representation we want to generate) to predict the context and in the process, we produce the representations. Another variant, called Skip Gram model does this.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"151e\">\n          <strong class=\"gv hl\">\n           Skip-Gram model:\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <figure class=\"ho hp hq hr hs ht dc dd paragraph-image\">\n          <div class=\"im in eq io ai\">\n           <div class=\"dc dd il\">\n            <div class=\"hz r eq ia\">\n             <div class=\"is r\">\n              <div class=\"hu hv s t u hw ai br hx hy\">\n               <img class=\"s t u hw ai ic id ie\" height=\"1877\" role=\"presentation\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/44/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png?q=20\" width=\"1400\"/>\n              </div>\n              <img class=\"hu hv s t u hw ai if\" height=\"1877\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png 700w\" width=\"1400\"/>\n              <noscript>\n               <img class=\"s t u hw ai\" height=\"1877\" role=\"presentation\" sizes=\"700px\" src=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/2800/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png\" srcset=\"https://miro.medium.com/max/552/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png 276w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1104/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png 552w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1280/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png 640w, https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0*Ta3qx5CQsrJloyCA.png 700w\" width=\"1400\"/>\n              </noscript>\n             </div>\n            </div>\n           </div>\n          </div>\n         </figure>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"12bd\">\n          This looks like multiple-context CBOW model just got flipped. To some extent that is true.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"afb0\">\n          We input the target word into the network. The model outputs C probability distributions. What does this mean?\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"842d\">\n          For each context position, we get C probability distributions of V probabilities, one for each word.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"4eb2\">\n          In both the cases, the network uses back-propagation to learn. Detailed math can be found\n          <a class=\"cq gf hh hi hj hk\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/pdf/1411.2738.pdf\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           here\n          </a>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"e171\">\n          <strong class=\"gv hl\">\n           Who wins?\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"7bb5\">\n          Both have their own advantages and disadvantages. According to Mikolov, Skip Gram works well with small amount of data and is found to represent rare words well.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"7a14\">\n          On the other hand, CBOW is faster and has better representations for more frequent words.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"3b3b\">\n          <strong class=\"gv hl\">\n           What\u2019s ahead?\n          </strong>\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"da1f\">\n          The above explanation is a very basic one. It just gives you a high-level idea of what word embeddings are and how Word2Vec works.\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"8fd4\">\n          There\u2019s a lot more to it. For example, to make the algorithm computationally more efficient, tricks like Hierarchical Softmax and Skip-Gram Negative Sampling are used. All of it can be found\n          <a class=\"cq gf hh hi hj hk\" href=\"https://arxiv.org/pdf/1411.2738.pdf\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           here\n          </a>\n          .\n         </p>\n         <p class=\"gt gu dt ar gv b gw gx gy gz ha hb hc hd he hf hg dl\" id=\"2fd4\">\n          Thanks for reading! If you have anything to ask or share, do comment. You can also connect with me on\n          <a class=\"cq gf hh hi hj hk\" href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/dhruvil-karani-66394b104/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" target=\"_blank\">\n           LinkedIn\n          </a>\n         </p>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </section>\n     </div>\n    </article>\n    <div class=\"hu dk it iu ai ja iy jb\" data-test-id=\"post-sidebar\">\n     <div class=\"n p\">\n      <div class=\"z ab ac ae af ag ah ai\">\n       <div class=\"jc n dg\">\n        <div class=\"dk\">\n         <div class=\"jd je r\">\n          <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gp gq bj bk fl fm\" href=\"https://towardsdatascience.com/?source=post_sidebar--------------------------post_sidebar-\" rel=\"noopener\">\n           <h2 class=\"aq jf jg as dt\">\n            Towards Data Science\n           </h2>\n          </a>\n          <div class=\"jh ji r\">\n           <h4 class=\"aq cl fe as br jj fg fh jk fj av\">\n            A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas, and codes.\n           </h4>\n          </div>\n          <div aria-hidden=\"true\" class=\"ge\">\n           <a class=\"jl fp ax ay jm bh bi jn bg ga aq b ar as at au gc gd df ge gf       <a class=\"cq cr az ba bb bc bd be bf bg gp gq bj bk fl fm\" .44.44 0 0 0 0-.63L8.43 9.22a.99.99 0 0 1-.3-.7.99.99 0 0 1 .3-.7 1 1 0 0 1 1.41 0l7 6.98a.44.44 0 0 0 .7-.5l-1.35-2.85c-.31-.68-.23-1.19.25-1.56a.85.85 0 0 1 .66-.16c.34.06.66.28.88.6L20.63 15c1.57
